content: 1 And it came to pass､ after the death of Joshua､ that the sons of Israel asked of Yahweh､ saying,— Who shall go up for us against the Canaanites, first､ to make war upon them?
content_old: 1 And it came to pass､ after the death of Joshua､ that the sons of Israel asked of Yahweh､ saying,— Who shall go up for us against the Canaanites, first､ to make war upon them?

content: 2 And Yahweh said— Judah shall go,—lo! I have delivered the land into his power.
content_old: 2 And Yahweh said— Judah shall go,—lo! I have delivered the land into his power.

content: 3 Then said Judah､ unto Simeon his brother— Come up with me into the territory allotted me､ and let us make war on the Canaanites､ then will I also go with thee､ into thy territory. So Simeon went with him.
content_old: 3 Then said Judah､ unto Simeon his brother— Come up with me into the territory allotted me､ and let us make war on the Canaanites､ then will I also go with thee､ into thy territory. So Simeon went with him.

content: 4 And Judah went up, and Yahweh delivered the Canaanites and the Perizzites into their hand,—and they smote them in Bezek, ten thousand men.
content_old: 4 And Judah went up, and Yahweh delivered the Canaanites and the Perizzites into their hand,—and they smote them in Bezek, ten thousand men.

content: 5 And they found Adoni-bezek in Bezek, and fought with him,—and smote the Canaanites and the Perizzites.
content_old: 5 And they found Adoni-bezek in Bezek, and fought with him,—and smote the Canaanites and the Perizzites.

content: 6 But Adoni-bezek fled, and they pursued him,—and took him, and cut off his thumbs､ and his great toes.
content_old: 6 But Adoni-bezek fled, and they pursued him,—and took him, and cut off his thumbs､ and his great toes.

content: 7 Then said Adoni-bezek— Seventy kings､ with their thumbs and great toes cut off have been picking up crumbs under my table, as I have done so hath God requited me. And they brought him into Jerusalem､ and he died there.
content_old: 7 Then said Adoni-bezek— Seventy kings､ with their thumbs and great toes cut off have been picking up crumbs under my table, as I have done so hath God requited me. And they brought him into Jerusalem､ and he died there.

content: 8 And the sons of Judah made war upon Jerusalem, and captured it､ and smote it with the edge of the sword,—and the city they set on fire.
content_old: 8 And the sons of Judah made war upon Jerusalem, and captured it､ and smote it with the edge of the sword,—and the city they set on fire.

content: 9 And afterwards the sons of Judah went down to make war upon the Canaanites,—dwelling in the hill country, and in the south､ and in the lowland.
content_old: 9 And afterwards the sons of Judah went down to make war upon the Canaanites,—dwelling in the hill country, and in the south､ and in the lowland.

content: 10 And Judah went against the Canaanites who were dwelling in Hebron, now the name of Hebron､ formerly was Kiriath-arba,—and they smote Sheshai and Ahiman､ and Talmai.
content_old: 10 And Judah went against the Canaanites who were dwelling in Hebron, now the name of Hebron､ formerly was Kiriath-arba,—and they smote Sheshai and Ahiman､ and Talmai.

content: 11 And he went from thence, against the inhabitants of Debir,—now the name of Debir､ formerly was Kiriath-sepher.
content_old: 11 And he went from thence, against the inhabitants of Debir,—now the name of Debir､ formerly was Kiriath-sepher.

content: 12 And Caleb said, He that smiteth Kiriath-sepher､ and captureth it I will give unto him Achsah my daughter､ to wife.
content_old: 12 And Caleb said, He that smiteth Kiriath-sepher､ and captureth it I will give unto him Achsah my daughter､ to wife.

content: 13 Then Othniel､ son of Kenaz､ Caleb’s younger brother､ captured it,—and he gave him Achsah his daughter､ to wife.
content_old: 13 Then Othniel､ son of Kenaz､ Caleb’s younger brother､ captured it,—and he gave him Achsah his daughter､ to wife.

content: 14 And it came to pass when she came that she moved him to ask of her father a field, and､ when she alighted from off the ass､ Caleb said unto her— What aileth thee?
content_old: 14 And it came to pass when she came that she moved him to ask of her father a field, and､ when she alighted from off the ass､ Caleb said unto her— What aileth thee?

content: 15 And she said unto him— Give me a present; for south land hast thou given me, give me therefore pools of water. So Caleb gave her Upper-pools, and Lower-pools.
content_old: 15 And she said unto him— Give me a present; for south land hast thou given me, give me therefore pools of water. So Caleb gave her Upper-pools, and Lower-pools.

content: 16 Now the sons of the Kenite､ father-in-law of Moses had come up from the city of palm-trees､ with the sons of Judah, into the wilderness of Judah, which is in the south of Arad,—so they went and dwelt with the people.
content_old: 16 Now the sons of the Kenite､ father-in-law of Moses had come up from the city of palm-trees､ with the sons of Judah, into the wilderness of Judah, which is in the south of Arad,—so they went and dwelt with the people.

content: 17 Then went Judah､ with Simeon his brother, and they smote the Canaanites dwelling in Zephath,—and devoted it to destruction, and the name of the city was called Hormah.
content_old: 17 Then went Judah､ with Simeon his brother, and they smote the Canaanites dwelling in Zephath,—and devoted it to destruction, and the name of the city was called Hormah.

content: 18 And Judah captured Gaza with the boundaries thereof, and Ashkelon､ with the boundaries thereof,—and Ekron､ with the boundaries thereof.
content_old: 18 And Judah captured Gaza with the boundaries thereof, and Ashkelon､ with the boundaries thereof,—and Ekron､ with the boundaries thereof.

content: 19 And it came to pass that Yahweh was with Judah, and he took possession of the hill country,—but did not dispossess the inhabitants of the vale, because they had chariots of iron.
content_old: 19 And it came to pass that Yahweh was with Judah, and he took possession of the hill country,—but did not dispossess the inhabitants of the vale, because they had chariots of iron.

content: 20 So they gave unto Caleb Hebron, as spake Moses,—and he drave out from thence the three sons of Anak.
content_old: 20 So they gave unto Caleb Hebron, as spake Moses,—and he drave out from thence the three sons of Anak.

content: 21 But the Jebusites dwelling in Jerusalem the sons of Benjamin did not drive out,—but the Jebusites have dwelt with the sons of Benjamin､ in Jerusalem, unto this day.
content_old: 21 But the Jebusites dwelling in Jerusalem the sons of Benjamin did not drive out,—but the Jebusites have dwelt with the sons of Benjamin､ in Jerusalem, unto this day.

content: 22 Then went up the house of Joseph—they also—unto Bethel,—and Yahweh was with them.
content_old: 22 Then went up the house of Joseph—they also—unto Bethel,—and Yahweh was with them.

content: 23 And the house of Joseph sent to spy out Bethel,—now the name of the city､ formerly was Luz.
content_old: 23 And the house of Joseph sent to spy out Bethel,—now the name of the city､ formerly was Luz.

content: 24 So the watchers saw a man､ coming forth from the city,—and they said unto him— Shew us､ we pray thee､ the way to get into the city, and we will deal with thee､ in lovingkindness.
content_old: 24 So the watchers saw a man､ coming forth from the city,—and they said unto him— Shew us､ we pray thee､ the way to get into the city, and we will deal with thee､ in lovingkindness.

content: 25 And he shewed them the way to get into the city, and they smote the city､ with the edge of the sword,—but the man and all his family they lot go.
content_old: 25 And he shewed them the way to get into the city, and they smote the city､ with the edge of the sword,—but the man and all his family they lot go.

content: 26 And the man went into the land of the Hittites,—and built a city､ and called the name thereof､ Luz, that is the name thereof, unto this day.
content_old: 26 And the man went into the land of the Hittites,—and built a city､ and called the name thereof､ Luz, that is the name thereof, unto this day.

content: 27 But Manasseh took not possession of Bethshean and her towns､ nor of Taanach and her towns, nor dispossessed the inhabitants of Dor and her towns､ nor the inhabitants of Ibleam､ and her towns, nor the inhabitants of Megiddo､ and her towns,—but the Canaanites were determined to remain in this land;
content_old: 27 But Manasseh took not possession of Bethshean and her towns､ nor of Taanach and her towns, nor dispossessed the inhabitants of Dor and her towns､ nor the inhabitants of Ibleam､ and her towns, nor the inhabitants of Megiddo､ and her towns,—but the Canaanites were determined to remain in this land;

content: 28 when Israel､ however､ had waxed strong they put the Canaanites under tribute,—though they dispossessed them not.
content_old: 28 when Israel､ however､ had waxed strong they put the Canaanites under tribute,—though they dispossessed them not.

content: 29 And Ephraim dispossessed not the Canaanites who were dwelling in Gezer,—so the Canaanites remained in their midst､ in Gezer.
content_old: 29 And Ephraim dispossessed not the Canaanites who were dwelling in Gezer,—so the Canaanites remained in their midst､ in Gezer.

content: 30 Zebulun dispossessed not the inhabitants of Kitrôn, nor the inhabitants of Nahalôl,—but the Canaanites remained in their midst, and came under tribute.
content_old: 30 Zebulun dispossessed not the inhabitants of Kitrôn, nor the inhabitants of Nahalôl,—but the Canaanites remained in their midst, and came under tribute.

content: 31 Asher dispossessed not the inhabitants of Acco, nor the inhabitants of Zidon,—nor of Ahlab､ nor of Achzib､ nor of Helbah, nor of Aphik nor of Rehob;
content_old: 31 Asher dispossessed not the inhabitants of Acco, nor the inhabitants of Zidon,—nor of Ahlab､ nor of Achzib､ nor of Helbah, nor of Aphik nor of Rehob;

content: 32 but the Asherites dwelt in the midst of the Canaanites､ the inhabitants of the land,—for they dispossessed them not.
content_old: 32 but the Asherites dwelt in the midst of the Canaanites､ the inhabitants of the land,—for they dispossessed them not.

content: 33 Naphtali dispossessed not the inhabitants of Beth-shemesh nor the inhabitants of Beth-anâth, but they dwelt in the midst of the Canaanites､ the inhabitants of the land,—and the inhabitants of Beth-shemesh､ and of Beth-anâth became theirs､ under tribute.
content_old: 33 Naphtali dispossessed not the inhabitants of Beth-shemesh nor the inhabitants of Beth-anâth, but they dwelt in the midst of the Canaanites､ the inhabitants of the land,—and the inhabitants of Beth-shemesh､ and of Beth-anâth became theirs､ under tribute.

content: 34 And the Amorites forced the sons of Dan into the hill country,—for they suffered them not to come down into the vale;
content_old: 34 And the Amorites forced the sons of Dan into the hill country,—for they suffered them not to come down into the vale;

content: 35 and though the Amorites were determined to remain in the hill country of Heres, in Aijalon､ and in Shaalbim yet was the hand of the house of Joseph heavy, so that they came under tribute.
content_old: 35 and though the Amorites were determined to remain in the hill country of Heres, in Aijalon､ and in Shaalbim yet was the hand of the house of Joseph heavy, so that they came under tribute.

content: 1 And the messenger of Yahweh came up from Gilgal､ unto Bochim. And he said— I led you up out of Egypt､ and brought you into the land､ which I had sworn unto your fathers, And I said I will not break my covenant with you､ to times age-abiding;
content_old: 1 And the messenger of Yahweh came up from Gilgal､ unto Bochim. And he said— I led you up out of Egypt､ and brought you into the land､ which I had sworn unto your fathers, And I said I will not break my covenant with you､ to times age-abiding;

content: 2 But ye must not solemnise a covenant with the inhabitants of this land, Their altars must ye tear down,— But ye have not hearkened unto my voice､ what is this ye have done?
content_old: 2 But ye must not solemnise a covenant with the inhabitants of this land, Their altars must ye tear down,— But ye have not hearkened unto my voice､ what is this ye have done?

content: 3 Wherefore also I said, I will not drive them out from before you,—but they shall be your adversaries, and their gods shall become unto you a snare.
content_old: 3 Wherefore also I said, I will not drive them out from before you,—but they shall be your adversaries, and their gods shall become unto you a snare.

content: 4 And it came to pass､ when the messenger of Yahweh had spoken these words unto all the sons of Israel that the people lifted up their voice､ and wept.
content_old: 4 And it came to pass､ when the messenger of Yahweh had spoken these words unto all the sons of Israel that the people lifted up their voice､ and wept.

content: 5 So they called the name of that place､ Bochim, and offered sacrifice there､ unto Yahweh.
content_old: 5 So they called the name of that place､ Bochim, and offered sacrifice there､ unto Yahweh.

content: 6 Now when Joshua had let the people go the sons of Israel went their way､ every man to his inheritance､ to take possession of the land.
content_old: 6 Now when Joshua had let the people go the sons of Israel went their way､ every man to his inheritance､ to take possession of the land.

content: 7 And the people served Yahweh all the days of Joshua,—and all the days of the elders who outlived Joshua, who had seen all the great work of Yahweh which he had wrought for Israel.
content_old: 7 And the people served Yahweh all the days of Joshua,—and all the days of the elders who outlived Joshua, who had seen all the great work of Yahweh which he had wrought for Israel.

content: 8 So then Joshua､ the son of Nun､ the servant of Yahweh､ died,—being a hundred and ten years old.
content_old: 8 So then Joshua､ the son of Nun､ the servant of Yahweh､ died,—being a hundred and ten years old.

content: 9 And they buried him within the bounds of his inheritance, in Timnath-heres､ in the hill country of Ephraim,—on the north of Mount Gaash.
content_old: 9 And they buried him within the bounds of his inheritance, in Timnath-heres､ in the hill country of Ephraim,—on the north of Mount Gaash.

content: 10 All that generation also were gathered unto their fathers,—and there arose another generation､ after them､ who had not known Yahweh, nor even the work which he had wrought for Israel.
content_old: 10 All that generation also were gathered unto their fathers,—and there arose another generation､ after them､ who had not known Yahweh, nor even the work which he had wrought for Israel.

content: 11 So the sons of Israel did the thing that was wicked in the sight of Yahweh,—and served the Baals;
content_old: 11 So the sons of Israel did the thing that was wicked in the sight of Yahweh,—and served the Baals;

content: 12 and forsook Yahweh､ the God of their fathers､ who brought them up out of the land of Egypt, and went after other gods､ from among the gods of the peoples who were round about them, and bowed themselves down unto them,—and angered Yahweh.
content_old: 12 and forsook Yahweh､ the God of their fathers､ who brought them up out of the land of Egypt, and went after other gods､ from among the gods of the peoples who were round about them, and bowed themselves down unto them,—and angered Yahweh.

content: 13 Yea､ they forsook Yahweh,—and did service unto the Baal and unto Ashtaroth.
content_old: 13 Yea､ they forsook Yahweh,—and did service unto the Baal and unto Ashtaroth.

content: 14 Then kindled the anger of Yahweh upon Israel, and he delivered them into the hand of spoilers, who plundered them,—and he sold them into the hand of their enemies round about, so that they could no longer stand before their enemies.
content_old: 14 Then kindled the anger of Yahweh upon Israel, and he delivered them into the hand of spoilers, who plundered them,—and he sold them into the hand of their enemies round about, so that they could no longer stand before their enemies.

content: 15 Whithersoever they went out the hand of Yahweh was found to be against them for misfortune, as spake Yahweh, and as sware Yahweh unto them,—and they were distressed exceedingly.
content_old: 15 Whithersoever they went out the hand of Yahweh was found to be against them for misfortune, as spake Yahweh, and as sware Yahweh unto them,—and they were distressed exceedingly.

content: 16 And though Yahweh raised up judges,—who saved them out of the hand of them that plundered them
content_old: 16 And though Yahweh raised up judges,—who saved them out of the hand of them that plundered them

content: 17 yet even unto their judges did they not hearken, for they went unchastely astray after other gods, and bowed themselves down to them,—they turned aside speedily out of the way wherein their fathers who hearkened unto the commandments of Yahweh､ walked, they did not so.
content_old: 17 yet even unto their judges did they not hearken, for they went unchastely astray after other gods, and bowed themselves down to them,—they turned aside speedily out of the way wherein their fathers who hearkened unto the commandments of Yahweh､ walked, they did not so.

content: 18 And when Yahweh raised them up judges then was Yahweh with the judges, and saved them out of the hand of their enemies, all the days of the judge,—for Yahweh was grieved at their outcry, because of them who oppressed them､ and ill-treated them.
content_old: 18 And when Yahweh raised them up judges then was Yahweh with the judges, and saved them out of the hand of their enemies, all the days of the judge,—for Yahweh was grieved at their outcry, because of them who oppressed them､ and ill-treated them.

content: 19 But when the judge was dead they again broke faith more than their fathers, by going their way after other gods, by serving them､ and bowing themselves down to them,—they ceased not from their doings nor from their stubborn way.
content_old: 19 But when the judge was dead they again broke faith more than their fathers, by going their way after other gods, by serving them､ and bowing themselves down to them,—they ceased not from their doings nor from their stubborn way.

content: 20 So then the anger of Yahweh kindled upon Israel､ and he said— Forasmuch as this nation have transgressed my covenant､ which I commanded their fathers, and have not hearkened unto my voice
content_old: 20 So then the anger of Yahweh kindled upon Israel､ and he said— Forasmuch as this nation have transgressed my covenant､ which I commanded their fathers, and have not hearkened unto my voice

content: 21 I also will no further dispossess a man from before them,—from among the nations which Joshua left remaining､ when he died;
content_old: 21 I also will no further dispossess a man from before them,—from among the nations which Joshua left remaining､ when he died;

content: 22 that I may､ by them､ put Israel to the proof,—whether they are going to be observant of the way of Yahweh､ to walk therein as their fathers observed it､ or not.
content_old: 22 that I may､ by them､ put Israel to the proof,—whether they are going to be observant of the way of Yahweh､ to walk therein as their fathers observed it､ or not.

content: 1 Now these are the nations which Yahweh left, that he might､ by them､ put Israel to the proof,—all who had not known any of the wars of Canaan;
content_old: 1 Now these are the nations which Yahweh left, that he might､ by them､ put Israel to the proof,—all who had not known any of the wars of Canaan;

content: 2 that the generations of the sons of Israel might certainly get to know､ by being taught to make war,—such､ at least､ as aforetime knew nothing thereof:—
content_old: 2 that the generations of the sons of Israel might certainly get to know､ by being taught to make war,—such､ at least､ as aforetime knew nothing thereof:—

content: 3 five lords of the Philistines､ and all the Canaanites､ and the Zidonians, and the Hivites dwelling in Mount Lebanon,—from Mount Baal-hermôn as far as the entering in of Hamath.
content_old: 3 five lords of the Philistines､ and all the Canaanites､ and the Zidonians, and the Hivites dwelling in Mount Lebanon,—from Mount Baal-hermôn as far as the entering in of Hamath.

content: 4 So then these were left ､ that､ by them､ he might put Israel to the proof,—to know whether they would hearken unto the commandments of Yahweh which he commanded their fathers by the hand of Moses.
content_old: 4 So then these were left ､ that､ by them､ he might put Israel to the proof,—to know whether they would hearken unto the commandments of Yahweh which he commanded their fathers by the hand of Moses.

content: 5 And thus the sons of Israel dwelt in the midst of the Canaanites,—the Hittites､ and the Amorites, and the Perizzites, and the Hivites､ and the Jebusites;
content_old: 5 And thus the sons of Israel dwelt in the midst of the Canaanites,—the Hittites､ and the Amorites, and the Perizzites, and the Hivites､ and the Jebusites;

content: 6 and took their daughters to be their wives, their own daughters moreover gave they unto their sons and they served their gods.
content_old: 6 and took their daughters to be their wives, their own daughters moreover gave they unto their sons and they served their gods.

content: 7 Thus did the sons of Israel the thing that was wicked in the sight of Yahweh, and forgat Yahweh their God,—and served the Baals and the Asherahs.
content_old: 7 Thus did the sons of Israel the thing that was wicked in the sight of Yahweh, and forgat Yahweh their God,—and served the Baals and the Asherahs.

content: 8 Then kindled the anger of Yahweh upon Israel, and he sold them into the hand of Chushan-rishathaim, king of Mesopotamia,—and the sons of Israel served Chuahan-rishathaim､ eight years.
content_old: 8 Then kindled the anger of Yahweh upon Israel, and he sold them into the hand of Chushan-rishathaim, king of Mesopotamia,—and the sons of Israel served Chuahan-rishathaim､ eight years.

content: 9 And the sons of Israel made outcry unto Yahweh, so Yahweh raised up a saviour unto the sons of Israel､ who saved them,—even Othniel son of Kenaz, Caleb’s younger brother.
content_old: 9 And the sons of Israel made outcry unto Yahweh, so Yahweh raised up a saviour unto the sons of Israel､ who saved them,—even Othniel son of Kenaz, Caleb’s younger brother.

content: 10 And the Spirit of Yahweh came upon him､ and he judged Israel, and went out to war, and Yahweh delivered into his hand､ Chushan-rishathaim､ king of Syria,—and his hand prevailed over Chushan-rishathaim.
content_old: 10 And the Spirit of Yahweh came upon him､ and he judged Israel, and went out to war, and Yahweh delivered into his hand､ Chushan-rishathaim､ king of Syria,—and his hand prevailed over Chushan-rishathaim.

content: 11 And the land had rest forty years,—and Othniel son of Kenaz､ died.
content_old: 11 And the land had rest forty years,—and Othniel son of Kenaz､ died.

content: 12 And the sons of Israel again did the thing that was wicked､ in the sight of Yahweh,—and Yahweh emboldened Eglon､ king of Moab､ against Israel, because they did the thing that was wicked in the sight of Yahweh;
content_old: 12 And the sons of Israel again did the thing that was wicked､ in the sight of Yahweh,—and Yahweh emboldened Eglon､ king of Moab､ against Israel, because they did the thing that was wicked in the sight of Yahweh;

content: 13 and he gathered unto him, the sons of Ammon､ and Amalek,—and came and smote Israel, and took possession of the city of palm-trees.
content_old: 13 and he gathered unto him, the sons of Ammon､ and Amalek,—and came and smote Israel, and took possession of the city of palm-trees.

content: 14 So the sons of Israel served Eglon king of Moab､ eighteen years.
content_old: 14 So the sons of Israel served Eglon king of Moab､ eighteen years.

content: 15 And the sons of Israel made outcry unto Yahweh, and Yahweh raised up unto them a saviour､ Ehud son of Gera､ a Benjamite, a man left-handed,—and the sons of Israel sent､ by his hand､ a present, unto Eglon king of Moab.
content_old: 15 And the sons of Israel made outcry unto Yahweh, and Yahweh raised up unto them a saviour､ Ehud son of Gera､ a Benjamite, a man left-handed,—and the sons of Israel sent､ by his hand､ a present, unto Eglon king of Moab.

content: 16 So Ehud made himself a sword which had two edges､ a cubit in length,—and girded it under his raiment, upon his right thigh.
content_old: 16 So Ehud made himself a sword which had two edges､ a cubit in length,—and girded it under his raiment, upon his right thigh.

content: 17 So he offered the present unto Eglon､ king of Moab,—now Eglon was an exceedingly fat man.
content_old: 17 So he offered the present unto Eglon､ king of Moab,—now Eglon was an exceedingly fat man.

content: 18 And so it was when he had made an end of offering the present that he sent away the people who had been bearing the present;
content_old: 18 And so it was when he had made an end of offering the present that he sent away the people who had been bearing the present;

content: 19 but he himself turned back from the images that were by Gilgal, and said､ A secret word have I､ unto thee､ O king! And he said— Silence! Thereupon went out from his presence all who had been standing near him.
content_old: 19 but he himself turned back from the images that were by Gilgal, and said､ A secret word have I､ unto thee､ O king! And he said— Silence! Thereupon went out from his presence all who had been standing near him.

content: 20 And Ehud came in unto him he having been sitting in a summer parlour､ which he had for himself alone, and Ehud said, A divine word have I､ unto thee. So he arose from off his seat.
content_old: 20 And Ehud came in unto him he having been sitting in a summer parlour､ which he had for himself alone, and Ehud said, A divine word have I､ unto thee. So he arose from off his seat.

content: 21 And Ehud put forth his left hand, and took the sword from off his right thigh,—and thrust it into his body;
content_old: 21 And Ehud put forth his left hand, and took the sword from off his right thigh,—and thrust it into his body;

content: 22 and the handle also went in after the blade､ and the flesh closed upon the blade, for he withdrew not the sword out of his body,—and he came out into the ante-chamber.
content_old: 22 and the handle also went in after the blade､ and the flesh closed upon the blade, for he withdrew not the sword out of his body,—and he came out into the ante-chamber.

content: 23 And when Ehud came out into the porch he closed the doors of the parlour upon him､ and bolted them.
content_old: 23 And when Ehud came out into the porch he closed the doors of the parlour upon him､ and bolted them.

content: 24 When he had come out his servants went in, and looked､ and lo! the doors of the parlour were bolted,—so they said, Surely he covereth his feet､ in the summer chamber.
content_old: 24 When he had come out his servants went in, and looked､ and lo! the doors of the parlour were bolted,—so they said, Surely he covereth his feet､ in the summer chamber.

content: 25 But though they tarried a long time yet lo! he opened not the doors of the parlour,—so they took the key､ and opened them, when lo! their lord, fallen to the ground dead.
content_old: 25 But though they tarried a long time yet lo! he opened not the doors of the parlour,—so they took the key､ and opened them, when lo! their lord, fallen to the ground dead.

content: 26 But Ehud escaped while they delayed,—yea he passed the images, and escaped into Seirah.
content_old: 26 But Ehud escaped while they delayed,—yea he passed the images, and escaped into Seirah.

content: 27 And so it was when he came that he blew with a horn､ throughout the hill country of Ephraim,—and the sons of Israel came down with him､ out of the hill country､ he being before them.
content_old: 27 And so it was when he came that he blew with a horn､ throughout the hill country of Ephraim,—and the sons of Israel came down with him､ out of the hill country､ he being before them.

content: 28 And he said unto them— Come down after me, for Yahweh hath delivered your enemies､ the Moabites､ into your hand. So they came down after him､ and captured the fords of the Jordan､ towards Moab, and suffered not a man to pass over.
content_old: 28 And he said unto them— Come down after me, for Yahweh hath delivered your enemies､ the Moabites､ into your hand. So they came down after him､ and captured the fords of the Jordan､ towards Moab, and suffered not a man to pass over.

content: 29 And they smote of Moab､ at that time､ about ten thousand men, every one a mighty man､ and every one a man of valour,—and there escaped not a man.
content_old: 29 And they smote of Moab､ at that time､ about ten thousand men, every one a mighty man､ and every one a man of valour,—and there escaped not a man.

content: 30 And Moab was subdued on that day, under the hand of Israel. And the land had rest eighty years, and Ehud judged them until his death.
content_old: 30 And Moab was subdued on that day, under the hand of Israel. And the land had rest eighty years, and Ehud judged them until his death.

content: 1 And the sons of Israel again did the thing that was, wicked in the sight of Yahweh,—when Ehud was dead.
content_old: 1 And the sons of Israel again did the thing that was, wicked in the sight of Yahweh,—when Ehud was dead.

content: 2 So Yahweh sold them into the hand of Jabin king of Canaan, who reigned in Hazor,—now the prince of his host was Sisera, and he dwelt in Harosheth of the nations.
content_old: 2 So Yahweh sold them into the hand of Jabin king of Canaan, who reigned in Hazor,—now the prince of his host was Sisera, and he dwelt in Harosheth of the nations.

content: 3 And the sons of Israel made outcry unto Yahweh,—for he had nine hundred chariots of iron and he oppressed the sons of Israel heavily､ twenty years.
content_old: 3 And the sons of Israel made outcry unto Yahweh,—for he had nine hundred chariots of iron and he oppressed the sons of Israel heavily､ twenty years.

content: 4 And Deborah､ a woman who was a prophetess､ wife of Lapidoth she was judging Israel､ at that time:
content_old: 4 And Deborah､ a woman who was a prophetess､ wife of Lapidoth she was judging Israel､ at that time:

content: 5 she used to sit､ therefore､ under the palm-tree of Deborah､ between Ramah and Bethel､ in the hill country of Ephraim,—and the sons of Israel came up to her､ for justice.
content_old: 5 she used to sit､ therefore､ under the palm-tree of Deborah､ between Ramah and Bethel､ in the hill country of Ephraim,—and the sons of Israel came up to her､ for justice.

content: 6 And she sent and called for Barak son of Abinoam, out of Kadeshnaphtali,—and said unto him— Hath not Yahweh God of Israel､ commanded,— Come and draw towards Mount Tabor, and bring with thee—ten thousand men, of the sons of Naphtali､ and of the sons of Zebulun;
content_old: 6 And she sent and called for Barak son of Abinoam, out of Kadeshnaphtali,—and said unto him— Hath not Yahweh God of Israel､ commanded,— Come and draw towards Mount Tabor, and bring with thee—ten thousand men, of the sons of Naphtali､ and of the sons of Zebulun;

content: 7 and I will draw unto thee､ unto the torrent of Kishon､ Sisera, prince of the host of Jabin, with his chariots､ and with his multitude,—and will deliver him into thy hand?
content_old: 7 and I will draw unto thee､ unto the torrent of Kishon､ Sisera, prince of the host of Jabin, with his chariots､ and with his multitude,—and will deliver him into thy hand?

content: 8 And Barak said unto her, If thou wilt go with me then will I go—but if thou wilt not go with me I will not go.
content_old: 8 And Barak said unto her, If thou wilt go with me then will I go—but if thou wilt not go with me I will not go.

content: 9 And she said— I will go with thee; only it shall not be thine own honour that shall arise from the journey which thou art about to take, for into the hand of a woman will Yahweh sell Sisera. So Deborah arose､ and went with Barak､ towards Kadesh.
content_old: 9 And she said— I will go with thee; only it shall not be thine own honour that shall arise from the journey which thou art about to take, for into the hand of a woman will Yahweh sell Sisera. So Deborah arose､ and went with Barak､ towards Kadesh.

content: 10 And Barak called together Zebulun and Naphtali､ towards Kadesh, and there went up at his feet—ten thousand men,—and Deborah went up with him.
content_old: 10 And Barak called together Zebulun and Naphtali､ towards Kadesh, and there went up at his feet—ten thousand men,—and Deborah went up with him.

content: 11 Now Heber the Kenite had separated himself from the Kenites, even from the sons of Hobab､ father-in-law of Moses,—and moved his tent as far as the oak of Zaanaim､ which is near Kadesh.
content_old: 11 Now Heber the Kenite had separated himself from the Kenites, even from the sons of Hobab､ father-in-law of Moses,—and moved his tent as far as the oak of Zaanaim､ which is near Kadesh.

content: 12 And they told Sisera that Barak､ son of Abinoam､ had gone up to Mount Tabor.
content_old: 12 And they told Sisera that Barak､ son of Abinoam､ had gone up to Mount Tabor.

content: 13 So Sisera called together all his chariots—nine hundred chariots of iron, and all the people that were with him,—from Harosheth of the nations､ unto the torrent of Kishon.
content_old: 13 So Sisera called together all his chariots—nine hundred chariots of iron, and all the people that were with him,—from Harosheth of the nations､ unto the torrent of Kishon.

content: 14 Then said Deborah unto Barak— Up! for this is the day on which Yahweh hath delivered Sisera into thy hand, hath not Yahweh gone forth before thee? So Barak went down from Mount Tabor, with ten thousand men after him.
content_old: 14 Then said Deborah unto Barak— Up! for this is the day on which Yahweh hath delivered Sisera into thy hand, hath not Yahweh gone forth before thee? So Barak went down from Mount Tabor, with ten thousand men after him.

content: 15 And Yahweh put to flight Sisera and all the chariots and all the host､ with the edge of the sword､ before Barak,—so Sisera alighted from his chariot､ and fled on foot.
content_old: 15 And Yahweh put to flight Sisera and all the chariots and all the host､ with the edge of the sword､ before Barak,—so Sisera alighted from his chariot､ and fled on foot.

content: 16 Now Barak pursued the chariots､ and the host, as far as Harosheth of the nations,—and all the host of Sisera fell by the edge of the sword, there was not left so much as one.
content_old: 16 Now Barak pursued the chariots､ and the host, as far as Harosheth of the nations,—and all the host of Sisera fell by the edge of the sword, there was not left so much as one.

content: 17 Now Siseia had fled on foot, unto the tent of Jael, wife of Heber the Kenite, for there was peace between Jabin､ king of Hazor､ and the house of Heber the Kenite.
content_old: 17 Now Siseia had fled on foot, unto the tent of Jael, wife of Heber the Kenite, for there was peace between Jabin､ king of Hazor､ and the house of Heber the Kenite.

content: 18 And Jael went out to meet Sisera, and said unto him: Turn aside､ my lord､ turn aside with me, do not fear. So he turned aside with her into the tent, and she threw over him a coverlet.
content_old: 18 And Jael went out to meet Sisera, and said unto him: Turn aside､ my lord､ turn aside with me, do not fear. So he turned aside with her into the tent, and she threw over him a coverlet.

content: 19 And he said unto her— Let me drink､ I pray thee､ a little water､ for I am thirsty. So she opened the bottle of milk､ and gave him to drink､ and spread over him the coverlet.
content_old: 19 And he said unto her— Let me drink､ I pray thee､ a little water､ for I am thirsty. So she opened the bottle of milk､ and gave him to drink､ and spread over him the coverlet.

content: 20 And he said unto her, Stand at the entrance of the tent,—and it shall be if any man come and ask thee and say— Is there here a man? that thou shalt say, There is not.
content_old: 20 And he said unto her, Stand at the entrance of the tent,—and it shall be if any man come and ask thee and say— Is there here a man? that thou shalt say, There is not.

content: 21 Then took Jael､ wife of Heber､ the tent-pin､ and put the mallet in her hand､ and went in unto him, softly, and smote the tent-pin into his temples, and it pierced through into the ground,—he being fast asleep and shrouded in darkness､ and he died.
content_old: 21 Then took Jael､ wife of Heber､ the tent-pin､ and put the mallet in her hand､ and went in unto him, softly, and smote the tent-pin into his temples, and it pierced through into the ground,—he being fast asleep and shrouded in darkness､ and he died.

content: 22 And lo! Barak—in pursuit of Sisera! So Jael went forth to meet him, and said unto him, Come and let me shew thee—the man whom thou art seeking. And he came in with her, and lo! Sisera—lying dead, with the tent-pin in his temples.
content_old: 22 And lo! Barak—in pursuit of Sisera! So Jael went forth to meet him, and said unto him, Come and let me shew thee—the man whom thou art seeking. And he came in with her, and lo! Sisera—lying dead, with the tent-pin in his temples.

content: 23 Thus God subdued､ on that day､ Jabin king of Canaan,—before the sons of Israel.
content_old: 23 Thus God subdued､ on that day､ Jabin king of Canaan,—before the sons of Israel.

content: 1 Then sang Deborah, and Barak､ son of Abinoam,—on that day､ saying:—
content_old: 1 Then sang Deborah, and Barak､ son of Abinoam,—on that day､ saying:—

content: 2 For the leadership of leaders in Israel, For the volunteering of the people,— Bless ye Yahweh!
content_old: 2 For the leadership of leaders in Israel, For the volunteering of the people,— Bless ye Yahweh!

content: 3 Hear､ ye kings! Give ear､ ye princes! I unto Yahweh—I will sing, Will make melody to Yahweh､ God of Israel.
content_old: 3 Hear､ ye kings! Give ear､ ye princes! I unto Yahweh—I will sing, Will make melody to Yahweh､ God of Israel.

content: 4 O Yahweh! When thou didst come forth out of Seir､ When thou didst march along out of the field of Edom Earth trembled, Heaven also poured forth,— Yea dark clouds poured forth waters;
content_old: 4 O Yahweh! When thou didst come forth out of Seir､ When thou didst march along out of the field of Edom Earth trembled, Heaven also poured forth,— Yea dark clouds poured forth waters;

content: 5 From mountains came down streams In presence of Yahweh,— From this Sinai､ In presence of Yahweh､ God of Israel.
content_old: 5 From mountains came down streams In presence of Yahweh,— From this Sinai､ In presence of Yahweh､ God of Israel.

content: 6 In the days of Shamgar son of Anath､ In the days of Jael The roads were forsaken,— And the frequenters of highways betook them to roundabout paths:
content_old: 6 In the days of Shamgar son of Anath､ In the days of Jael The roads were forsaken,— And the frequenters of highways betook them to roundabout paths:

content: 7 There was a failure of rulers､ In Israel a failure,— Until I arose､ a Deborah, Arose､ a mother in Israel:—
content_old: 7 There was a failure of rulers､ In Israel a failure,— Until I arose､ a Deborah, Arose､ a mother in Israel:—

content: 8 They chose gods that were new, Then—war at the gates! Was there a shield to be seen? Or a spear? Among forty thousand in Israel?
content_old: 8 They chose gods that were new, Then—war at the gates! Was there a shield to be seen? Or a spear? Among forty thousand in Israel?

content: 9 My heart saith— For the governors of Israel, For the volunteers among the people Bless ye Yahweh!
content_old: 9 My heart saith— For the governors of Israel, For the volunteers among the people Bless ye Yahweh!

content: 10 Ye that ride on white asses､ speak! Ye that sit on carpets､ speak! And ye that walk upon the road､ speak!
content_old: 10 Ye that ride on white asses､ speak! Ye that sit on carpets､ speak! And ye that walk upon the road､ speak!

content: 11 In the place of the noise of bowmen among the wells There laud ye— The righteous acts of Yahweh, The righteous acts of his rule over Israel. Then had come down to the gates the people of Yahweh.
content_old: 11 In the place of the noise of bowmen among the wells There laud ye— The righteous acts of Yahweh, The righteous acts of his rule over Israel. Then had come down to the gates the people of Yahweh.

content: 12 Awake! awake! Deborah, Awake! awake! utter words of song,— Arise! Barak､ And bind fast thy captives､ O son of Abinoam!
content_old: 12 Awake! awake! Deborah, Awake! awake! utter words of song,— Arise! Barak､ And bind fast thy captives､ O son of Abinoam!

content: 13 Then came down a remnant to the nobles—a people,— Yahweh came down with me against the mighty.
content_old: 13 Then came down a remnant to the nobles—a people,— Yahweh came down with me against the mighty.

content: 14 Out of Ephraim came down they whose root was in Amalek, After thee Benjamin､ among thy tribes,— Out of Machir had come down governors, And out of Zebulun such as bear aloft the staff of the marshal;
content_old: 14 Out of Ephraim came down they whose root was in Amalek, After thee Benjamin､ among thy tribes,— Out of Machir had come down governors, And out of Zebulun such as bear aloft the staff of the marshal;

content: 15 And my princes in Issachar were with Deborah, Yea Issachar was the support of Barak, Into the vale rushed they forth at his feet. Among the divisions of Reuben great were the resolves of the heart:
content_old: 15 And my princes in Issachar were with Deborah, Yea Issachar was the support of Barak, Into the vale rushed they forth at his feet. Among the divisions of Reuben great were the resolves of the heart:

content: 16 Wherefore abodest thou among the folds? To hear the mocking of the flocks? The divisions of Reuben had great counsellings of heart.
content_old: 16 Wherefore abodest thou among the folds? To hear the mocking of the flocks? The divisions of Reuben had great counsellings of heart.

content: 17 Gilead beyond the Jordan took his rest, But Dan wherefore remained he with the ships? Asher abode by the shore of the seas, And by his creeks must needs rest.
content_old: 17 Gilead beyond the Jordan took his rest, But Dan wherefore remained he with the ships? Asher abode by the shore of the seas, And by his creeks must needs rest.

content: 18 Zebulun—a people that scorned their souls unto death; And Naphtali—upon the heights of the field.
content_old: 18 Zebulun—a people that scorned their souls unto death; And Naphtali—upon the heights of the field.

content: 19 On came kings､ they fought, Then fought the kings of Canaan, In Taanach､ By the waters of Megiddo,— Plunder of silver they took not away!
content_old: 19 On came kings､ they fought, Then fought the kings of Canaan, In Taanach､ By the waters of Megiddo,— Plunder of silver they took not away!

content: 20 From heaven was the battle fought,— The stars in their courses fought against Sisera.
content_old: 20 From heaven was the battle fought,— The stars in their courses fought against Sisera.

content: 21 The torrent of Kishon swept them away, The torrent of olden times､ the torrent of Kishon! Let my soul march along､ with victorious strengeth!
content_old: 21 The torrent of Kishon swept them away, The torrent of olden times､ the torrent of Kishon! Let my soul march along､ with victorious strengeth!

content: 22 Then stamped hoofs of horses, With the gallopings､ gallopings of his mighty steeds.
content_old: 22 Then stamped hoofs of horses, With the gallopings､ gallopings of his mighty steeds.

content: 23 Curse ye Meroz､ saith the messenger of Yahweh, Curse ye with a curse､ the inhabitants thereof,— Because they came not in to the help of Yahweh, To the help of Yahweh､ against the mighty.
content_old: 23 Curse ye Meroz､ saith the messenger of Yahweh, Curse ye with a curse､ the inhabitants thereof,— Because they came not in to the help of Yahweh, To the help of Yahweh､ against the mighty.

content: 24 Blessed above women shall be Jael, wife of Heber the Kenite,— Above women in the tent be blessed:
content_old: 24 Blessed above women shall be Jael, wife of Heber the Kenite,— Above women in the tent be blessed:

content: 25 Water he asked､ Milk she gave,— In a bowl for nobles presented cream:
content_old: 25 Water he asked､ Milk she gave,— In a bowl for nobles presented cream:

content: 26 Her hand､ to the tent-pin put she forth, And her right hand to the toilers’ mallet,— Then smote she Sisera､ She shattered his head, Yea she split open and pierced through his temples:
content_old: 26 Her hand､ to the tent-pin put she forth, And her right hand to the toilers’ mallet,— Then smote she Sisera､ She shattered his head, Yea she split open and pierced through his temples:

content: 27 Between her feet he bowed— he fell､ he lay,— Between her feet he bowed— he fell, Where he bowed There he fell—destroyed!
content_old: 27 Between her feet he bowed— he fell､ he lay,— Between her feet he bowed— he fell, Where he bowed There he fell—destroyed!

content: 28 Through the window looked out and shrilly cried､ The mother of Sisera､ through the lattice,— Why is his chariot ashamed to come? Why delay the wheels of his chariot?
content_old: 28 Through the window looked out and shrilly cried､ The mother of Sisera､ through the lattice,— Why is his chariot ashamed to come? Why delay the wheels of his chariot?

content: 29 The wise ladies､ her princesses responded,— Nay! she returned answer to herself:—
content_old: 29 The wise ladies､ her princesses responded,— Nay! she returned answer to herself:—

content: 30 Is it not They keep finding—dividing spoil､ One damsel､ two damsels､ to every several hero, Spoil of divers coloured raiment for Sisera, Spoil of divers coloured raiment､ embroidered, Coloured raiment richly embroidered､ On the necks of them who are taken as spoil?
content_old: 30 Is it not They keep finding—dividing spoil､ One damsel､ two damsels､ to every several hero, Spoil of divers coloured raiment for Sisera, Spoil of divers coloured raiment､ embroidered, Coloured raiment richly embroidered､ On the necks of them who are taken as spoil?

content: 1 And the sons of Israel did the thing that was wicked､ in the sight of Yahweh,—so Yahweh delivered them into the hand of Midian seven years;
content_old: 1 And the sons of Israel did the thing that was wicked､ in the sight of Yahweh,—so Yahweh delivered them into the hand of Midian seven years;

content: 2 and the hand of Midian prevailed against Israel,—because of Midian did the sons of Israel prepare for themselves the hollows which were in the mountains, and the caves､ and the strongholds.
content_old: 2 and the hand of Midian prevailed against Israel,—because of Midian did the sons of Israel prepare for themselves the hollows which were in the mountains, and the caves､ and the strongholds.

content: 3 And so it used to be､ if Israel had sown then came up Midian and Amalek and the sons of the east､ yea came up against them,
content_old: 3 And so it used to be､ if Israel had sown then came up Midian and Amalek and the sons of the east､ yea came up against them,

content: 4 and encamped against them､ and destroyed the increase of the land, until thou comest unto Gaza,—neither left they sustenance in Israel, nor sheep nor ox､ nor ass;
content_old: 4 and encamped against them､ and destroyed the increase of the land, until thou comest unto Gaza,—neither left they sustenance in Israel, nor sheep nor ox､ nor ass;

content: 5 for they with their cattle used to come up､ with their tents—yea they used to come like locusts､ for multitude, both they and their cattle were without number,—so they came into the land､ to lay it waste.
content_old: 5 for they with their cattle used to come up､ with their tents—yea they used to come like locusts､ for multitude, both they and their cattle were without number,—so they came into the land､ to lay it waste.

content: 6 Thus was Israel greatly impoverished､ because of Midian,—and the sons of Israel made outcry unto Yahweh.
content_old: 6 Thus was Israel greatly impoverished､ because of Midian,—and the sons of Israel made outcry unto Yahweh.

content: 7 And it came to pass when the sons of Israel cried unto Yahweh,—on account of Midian
content_old: 7 And it came to pass when the sons of Israel cried unto Yahweh,—on account of Midian

content: 8 then sent Yahweh a prophet unto the sons of Israel,—who said unto them— Thus saith Yahweh､ God of Israel､ I led you up out of Egypt, And brought you forth out of the house of servants;
content_old: 8 then sent Yahweh a prophet unto the sons of Israel,—who said unto them— Thus saith Yahweh､ God of Israel､ I led you up out of Egypt, And brought you forth out of the house of servants;

content: 9 Yea I rescued you out of the hand of Egypt, And out of the hand of all who oppressed you,— That I might drive them out from before you, And I gave unto you their land;
content_old: 9 Yea I rescued you out of the hand of Egypt, And out of the hand of all who oppressed you,— That I might drive them out from before you, And I gave unto you their land;

content: 10 Yea and I said to you,— I､ Yahweh am your God, Ye must not fear the gods of the Amorites, in whose land ye are about to dwell,— But ye have not hearkened unto my voice.
content_old: 10 Yea and I said to you,— I､ Yahweh am your God, Ye must not fear the gods of the Amorites, in whose land ye are about to dwell,— But ye have not hearkened unto my voice.

content: 11 Then came the messenger of Yahweh､ and sat down under the oak which was in Ophrah, which belonged to Joash､ the Abiezrite; and Gideon his son was beating out wheat in the winepress, to escape the notice of the Midianites;
content_old: 11 Then came the messenger of Yahweh､ and sat down under the oak which was in Ophrah, which belonged to Joash､ the Abiezrite; and Gideon his son was beating out wheat in the winepress, to escape the notice of the Midianites;

content: 12 so the messenger of Yahweh appeared unto him,—and said unto him, Yahweh is with thee､ thou mighty man of valour!
content_old: 12 so the messenger of Yahweh appeared unto him,—and said unto him, Yahweh is with thee､ thou mighty man of valour!

content: 13 And Gideon said unto him— Pardon､ my lord! if Yahweh be with us then wherefore hath all this befallen us? and where are all his wonders､ which our fathers have recounted to us—saying､ Was it not out of Egypt that Yahweh brought us up? But now hath Yahweh abandoned us, and delivered us into the hand of Midian.
content_old: 13 And Gideon said unto him— Pardon､ my lord! if Yahweh be with us then wherefore hath all this befallen us? and where are all his wonders､ which our fathers have recounted to us—saying､ Was it not out of Egypt that Yahweh brought us up? But now hath Yahweh abandoned us, and delivered us into the hand of Midian.

content: 14 And Yahweh turned unto him and said— Go in this thy might, and thou shalt gave Israel､ out of the hand of Midian,—have I not sent thee?
content_old: 14 And Yahweh turned unto him and said— Go in this thy might, and thou shalt gave Israel､ out of the hand of Midian,—have I not sent thee?

content: 15 And he said unto him— Pardon､ O my Lord! How shall I save Israel? Lo! my thousand is the poorest in Manasseh, and I am the youngest in the house of my father.
content_old: 15 And he said unto him— Pardon､ O my Lord! How shall I save Israel? Lo! my thousand is the poorest in Manasseh, and I am the youngest in the house of my father.

content: 16 And Yahweh said unto him— I will be with thee,—so shalt thou smite the Midianites､ as one man.
content_old: 16 And Yahweh said unto him— I will be with thee,—so shalt thou smite the Midianites､ as one man.

content: 17 And he said unto him, If､ I beseech thee､ I have found favour in thine eyes then wilt thou work for me a sign, that it is thou who art speaking with me.
content_old: 17 And he said unto him, If､ I beseech thee､ I have found favour in thine eyes then wilt thou work for me a sign, that it is thou who art speaking with me.

content: 18 Do not､ I beseech thee､ withdraw from hence､ until I come unto thee, and bring forth my present, and set it before thee. And he said: I will tarry until thou return.
content_old: 18 Do not､ I beseech thee､ withdraw from hence､ until I come unto thee, and bring forth my present, and set it before thee. And he said: I will tarry until thou return.

content: 19 So Gideon went in､ and made ready a kid of the goats､ and of an ephah of meal unleavened cakes, the flesh he put in a basket, and the broth he put in a pot,—and brought them forth unto him､ under the oak､ and presented them.
content_old: 19 So Gideon went in､ and made ready a kid of the goats､ and of an ephah of meal unleavened cakes, the flesh he put in a basket, and the broth he put in a pot,—and brought them forth unto him､ under the oak､ and presented them.

content: 20 And the messenger of God said unto him— Take the flesh and the cakes､ and set them on this crag, and the broth do thou pour out. And he did so.
content_old: 20 And the messenger of God said unto him— Take the flesh and the cakes､ and set them on this crag, and the broth do thou pour out. And he did so.

content: 21 Then the messenger of Yahweh put forth the end of the staff､ that was in his hand, and touched the flesh､ and the cakes,—and there came up fire out of the rock､ and consumed the flesh､ and the cakes, and the messenger of Yahweh had departed out of his sight.
content_old: 21 Then the messenger of Yahweh put forth the end of the staff､ that was in his hand, and touched the flesh､ and the cakes,—and there came up fire out of the rock､ and consumed the flesh､ and the cakes, and the messenger of Yahweh had departed out of his sight.

content: 22 Then saw Gideon that the messenger of Yahweh it was,—so Gideon said— Alas､ My Lord Yahweh! forasmuch as I have seen the messenger of Yahweh face to face!
content_old: 22 Then saw Gideon that the messenger of Yahweh it was,—so Gideon said— Alas､ My Lord Yahweh! forasmuch as I have seen the messenger of Yahweh face to face!

content: 23 And Yahweh said unto him— Peace be unto thee! Do not fear,—thou shalt not die.
content_old: 23 And Yahweh said unto him— Peace be unto thee! Do not fear,—thou shalt not die.

content: 24 So Gideon built there an altar unto Yahweh, and called it､ Yahweh-shâlôm. Unto this day it remaineth､ in Ophrah of the Abiezrites.
content_old: 24 So Gideon built there an altar unto Yahweh, and called it､ Yahweh-shâlôm. Unto this day it remaineth､ in Ophrah of the Abiezrites.

content: 25 And it came to pass､ on that night, that Yahweh said unto him— Take the young bullock that belongeth to thy father, even the second bullock of seven years,—and throw thou down the altar of Baal､ that belongeth to thy father, and the sacred stem that is by it shalt thou cut down.
content_old: 25 And it came to pass､ on that night, that Yahweh said unto him— Take the young bullock that belongeth to thy father, even the second bullock of seven years,—and throw thou down the altar of Baal､ that belongeth to thy father, and the sacred stem that is by it shalt thou cut down.

content: 26 Then shalt thou build an altar､ unto Yahweh thy God､ on the top of this fort､ with the pile,—and shalt take the second bullock, and cause it to go up as an ascending-sacrifice, with the wood of the sacred stem which thou shalt cut down.
content_old: 26 Then shalt thou build an altar､ unto Yahweh thy God､ on the top of this fort､ with the pile,—and shalt take the second bullock, and cause it to go up as an ascending-sacrifice, with the wood of the sacred stem which thou shalt cut down.

content: 27 So Gideon took ten men from among his servants, and did as Yahweh had spoken unto him,—and so it was that as he too much feared the house of his father､ and the men of the city､ to do it by day he did it by night.
content_old: 27 So Gideon took ten men from among his servants, and did as Yahweh had spoken unto him,—and so it was that as he too much feared the house of his father､ and the men of the city､ to do it by day he did it by night.

content: 28 And the men of the city rose up early in the morning, and lo! the altar of Baal had been overthrown, and the sacred stem that was by it had been cut down､ and the second bullock had been caused to ascend upon the altar that had been built.
content_old: 28 And the men of the city rose up early in the morning, and lo! the altar of Baal had been overthrown, and the sacred stem that was by it had been cut down､ and the second bullock had been caused to ascend upon the altar that had been built.

content: 29 So they said､ one to another, Who hath done this thing? And they inquired､ and made search, and it was said, Gideon son of Joash hath done this thing.
content_old: 29 So they said､ one to another, Who hath done this thing? And they inquired､ and made search, and it was said, Gideon son of Joash hath done this thing.

content: 30 So the men of the city said unto Joash, Bring forth thy son､ that he may die,—because he hath overthrown the altar of Baal, and because he hath cut down the sacred stem that was by it.
content_old: 30 So the men of the city said unto Joash, Bring forth thy son､ that he may die,—because he hath overthrown the altar of Baal, and because he hath cut down the sacred stem that was by it.

content: 31 And Joash said unto all who stood by him— Will ye plead for Baal､ or will ye save him? Whoso pleadeth for him let him be put to death while it is yet morning,—if a god he be let him plead for himself, because one hath overthrown his altar.
content_old: 31 And Joash said unto all who stood by him— Will ye plead for Baal､ or will ye save him? Whoso pleadeth for him let him be put to death while it is yet morning,—if a god he be let him plead for himself, because one hath overthrown his altar.

content: 32 So he was called on that day､ Jerub-baal､ saying,— Let Baal plead against him. Because he had overthrown his altar.
content_old: 32 So he was called on that day､ Jerub-baal､ saying,— Let Baal plead against him. Because he had overthrown his altar.

content: 33 Now all the Midianites and the Amalekites and the sons of the east were gathered together,—and they crossed over and pitched in the vale of Jezreel.
content_old: 33 Now all the Midianites and the Amalekites and the sons of the east were gathered together,—and they crossed over and pitched in the vale of Jezreel.

content: 34 But the spirit of Yahweh clothed Gideon,—so he blew with a horn, and Abiezer was gathered after him.
content_old: 34 But the spirit of Yahweh clothed Gideon,—so he blew with a horn, and Abiezer was gathered after him.

content: 35 Messengers also sent he throughout all Manasseh, and they also were gathered after him,—messengers also sent he throughout Asher､ and throughout Zebulun､ and throughout Naphtali, and they came up to meet them.
content_old: 35 Messengers also sent he throughout all Manasseh, and they also were gathered after him,—messengers also sent he throughout Asher､ and throughout Zebulun､ and throughout Naphtali, and they came up to meet them.

content: 36 And Gideon said unto God,— If thou art about to bring salvation､ by my hand､ unto Israel､ as thou hast spoken
content_old: 36 And Gideon said unto God,— If thou art about to bring salvation､ by my hand､ unto Israel､ as thou hast spoken

content: 37 lo! I am placing a woollen fleece､ on the threshing-floor,—if dew be on the fleece alone and on all the ground it be dry then shall I know that thou wilt bring salvation､ by my hand､ unto Israel､ as thou hast spoken.
content_old: 37 lo! I am placing a woollen fleece､ on the threshing-floor,—if dew be on the fleece alone and on all the ground it be dry then shall I know that thou wilt bring salvation､ by my hand､ unto Israel､ as thou hast spoken.

content: 38 And it was so and he rose up early､ on the morrow, and pressed together the fleece,—and wrung out the dew from the fleece, a small bowl full of water.
content_old: 38 And it was so and he rose up early､ on the morrow, and pressed together the fleece,—and wrung out the dew from the fleece, a small bowl full of water.

content: 39 Then said Gideon unto God, Let not thine anger kindle upon me, but let me speak､ only this once,— Let me､ I pray thee､ put to the proof only this once with the fleece, I pray thee､ let it be dry on the fleece alone､ while on all the ground there be dew.
content_old: 39 Then said Gideon unto God, Let not thine anger kindle upon me, but let me speak､ only this once,— Let me､ I pray thee､ put to the proof only this once with the fleece, I pray thee､ let it be dry on the fleece alone､ while on all the ground there be dew.

content: 1 Then Jerubbaal､ the same is Gideon､ and all the people that were with him､ rose up early, and encamped by the fountain of Harod,—and the camp of Midian was on the north of them, by the hill of Moreh､ in the vale.
content_old: 1 Then Jerubbaal､ the same is Gideon､ and all the people that were with him､ rose up early, and encamped by the fountain of Harod,—and the camp of Midian was on the north of them, by the hill of Moreh､ in the vale.

content: 2 And Yahweh said unto Gideon, Too many are the people that are with thee, for me to deliver the Midianites into their hand,—lest Israel vaunt themselves against me､ saying, Mine own hand hath saved me.
content_old: 2 And Yahweh said unto Gideon, Too many are the people that are with thee, for me to deliver the Midianites into their hand,—lest Israel vaunt themselves against me､ saying, Mine own hand hath saved me.

content: 3 Now therefore､ proclaim､ I pray thee､ in the ears of the people､ saying, Whoso feareth and trembleth—let him turn and go back from Mount Gilead. And there returned of the people twenty-two thousand, and ten thousand remained.
content_old: 3 Now therefore､ proclaim､ I pray thee､ in the ears of the people､ saying, Whoso feareth and trembleth—let him turn and go back from Mount Gilead. And there returned of the people twenty-two thousand, and ten thousand remained.

content: 4 Then said Yahweh unto Gideon— Yet are the people too many, take them down unto the waters, that I may prove them for thee､ there,—and it shall be､ that he of whom I say unto thee､ This one shall go with thee the same shall go with thee, and every one of whom I say unto thee､ This one shall not go with thee the same shall not go.
content_old: 4 Then said Yahweh unto Gideon— Yet are the people too many, take them down unto the waters, that I may prove them for thee､ there,—and it shall be､ that he of whom I say unto thee､ This one shall go with thee the same shall go with thee, and every one of whom I say unto thee､ This one shall not go with thee the same shall not go.

content: 5 So he took down the people unto the waters,—and Yahweh said unto Gideon— Every one that lappeth with his tongue of the water､ as a dog lappeth thou shalt set him by himself, likewise every one that boweth down upon his knees､ to drink.
content_old: 5 So he took down the people unto the waters,—and Yahweh said unto Gideon— Every one that lappeth with his tongue of the water､ as a dog lappeth thou shalt set him by himself, likewise every one that boweth down upon his knees､ to drink.

content: 6 And so it was､ that the number of them that lapped with their hand to their mouth was three hundred men,—but all the rest of the people bowed down on their knees､ to drink water.
content_old: 6 And so it was､ that the number of them that lapped with their hand to their mouth was three hundred men,—but all the rest of the people bowed down on their knees､ to drink water.

content: 7 Then said Yahweh unto Gideon— By the three hundred men that lapped will I save you, and deliver the Midianites into thy hand; and let all the rest of the people go every man to his own place.
content_old: 7 Then said Yahweh unto Gideon— By the three hundred men that lapped will I save you, and deliver the Midianites into thy hand; and let all the rest of the people go every man to his own place.

content: 8 So the people took provisions in their hand､ and their horns､ but every man of Israel besides sent he away every man to his home, whereas the three hundred men he retained. Now the camp of Midian was beneath him in the vale.
content_old: 8 So the people took provisions in their hand､ and their horns､ but every man of Israel besides sent he away every man to his home, whereas the three hundred men he retained. Now the camp of Midian was beneath him in the vale.

content: 9 And it came to pass on that night that Yahweh said unto him, Arise! go down against the camp,—for I have delivered it into thy hand.
content_old: 9 And it came to pass on that night that Yahweh said unto him, Arise! go down against the camp,—for I have delivered it into thy hand.

content: 10 Or if thou art afraid to go down go down—thou and Purah thy young man､ unto the camp;
content_old: 10 Or if thou art afraid to go down go down—thou and Purah thy young man､ unto the camp;

content: 11 so shalt thou hear what they shall say,—and afterward shall thy hands grow strong, and thou shalt go down against the camp. Then went he down､ he and Purah his young man, unto the outmost part of the armed men that were in the camp.
content_old: 11 so shalt thou hear what they shall say,—and afterward shall thy hands grow strong, and thou shalt go down against the camp. Then went he down､ he and Purah his young man, unto the outmost part of the armed men that were in the camp.

content: 12 Now the Midianites and the Amalekites and all the sons of the east were lying along in the vale, like locusts for multitude,—their camels also were without number, as the sand that is by the sea side､ for multitude.
content_old: 12 Now the Midianites and the Amalekites and all the sons of the east were lying along in the vale, like locusts for multitude,—their camels also were without number, as the sand that is by the sea side､ for multitude.

content: 13 And Gideon came in, and lo! a man relating to his neighbour a dream,—and he said— Lo! a dream have I dreamt､ and lo! a round cake of barley bread tumbling into the camp of Midian, and it came as far as the tent—and smote it that it fell､ and turned it upside down､ and the tent lay along.
content_old: 13 And Gideon came in, and lo! a man relating to his neighbour a dream,—and he said— Lo! a dream have I dreamt､ and lo! a round cake of barley bread tumbling into the camp of Midian, and it came as far as the tent—and smote it that it fell､ and turned it upside down､ and the tent lay along.

content: 14 Then responded his neighbour and said:— Nothing else is this, than the sword of Gideon son of Joash､ a man of Israel,—God hath delivered into his hand､ both Midian and all the host.
content_old: 14 Then responded his neighbour and said:— Nothing else is this, than the sword of Gideon son of Joash､ a man of Israel,—God hath delivered into his hand､ both Midian and all the host.

content: 15 And it was so when Gideon heard the story of the dream､ and the interpretation thereof that he bowed himself down,—and returned unto the camp of Israel, and said— Arise! for Yahweh hath delivered into your hand the host of Midian.
content_old: 15 And it was so when Gideon heard the story of the dream､ and the interpretation thereof that he bowed himself down,—and returned unto the camp of Israel, and said— Arise! for Yahweh hath delivered into your hand the host of Midian.

content: 16 And he divided the three hundred men､ into three companies,—and put horns into the hands of them all､ with empty pitchers, and torches inside the pitchers.
content_old: 16 And he divided the three hundred men､ into three companies,—and put horns into the hands of them all､ with empty pitchers, and torches inside the pitchers.

content: 17 Then he said unto them, On me shall ye look､ and in like manner shall ye do,—and lo! when I am coming unto the outermost part of the eamp then shall it be､ that as I do so shall ye do.
content_old: 17 Then he said unto them, On me shall ye look､ and in like manner shall ye do,—and lo! when I am coming unto the outermost part of the eamp then shall it be､ that as I do so shall ye do.

content: 18 When I shall blow with the horn, I and all who are with me then shall ye also､ round about all the camp blow with your horns, and shall say､ For Yahweh and for Gideon!
content_old: 18 When I shall blow with the horn, I and all who are with me then shall ye also､ round about all the camp blow with your horns, and shall say､ For Yahweh and for Gideon!

content: 19 So Gideon came､ and the hundred men that were with him､ unto the outermost part of the camp､ at the beginning of the middle watch, they had but newly set the watchers,—and they blew with the horns, and brake in pieces the pitchers､ that were in their hand.
content_old: 19 So Gideon came､ and the hundred men that were with him､ unto the outermost part of the camp､ at the beginning of the middle watch, they had but newly set the watchers,—and they blew with the horns, and brake in pieces the pitchers､ that were in their hand.

content: 20 Yea the three companies blew with the horns､ and shivered the pitchers, and caught hold—with their left hands—of the torches, while in their right hands were the horns､ to blow with,—and they cried, A sword for Yahweh､ and for Gideon!
content_old: 20 Yea the three companies blew with the horns､ and shivered the pitchers, and caught hold—with their left hands—of the torches, while in their right hands were the horns､ to blow with,—and they cried, A sword for Yahweh､ and for Gideon!

content: 21 And they stood still､ every man in his place, round about the camp,—and all the host ran and shouted､ and fled.
content_old: 21 And they stood still､ every man in his place, round about the camp,—and all the host ran and shouted､ and fled.

content: 22 When the three hundred blew the horns､ Yahweh set the sword of every man､ against his neighbour､ and against all the host,—and the host fled､ as far as the Place of Acacias､ towards Zererath, as far as the border of Abel-meholah､ by Tabbath.
content_old: 22 When the three hundred blew the horns､ Yahweh set the sword of every man､ against his neighbour､ and against all the host,—and the host fled､ as far as the Place of Acacias､ towards Zererath, as far as the border of Abel-meholah､ by Tabbath.

content: 23 And the men of Israel were called together､ out of Naphtali and out of Asher､ and out of all Manasseh,—and pursued Midian.
content_old: 23 And the men of Israel were called together､ out of Naphtali and out of Asher､ and out of all Manasseh,—and pursued Midian.

content: 24 And messengers did Gideon send through all the hill country of Ephraim､ saying— Go down to meet Midian, and capture､ before them､ the waters, as far as Beth-barah､ and the Jordan. So all the men of Ephraim were called out､ and captured the waters, as far as Beth-barah､ and the Jordan.
content_old: 24 And messengers did Gideon send through all the hill country of Ephraim､ saying— Go down to meet Midian, and capture､ before them､ the waters, as far as Beth-barah､ and the Jordan. So all the men of Ephraim were called out､ and captured the waters, as far as Beth-barah､ and the Jordan.

content: 1 And the men of Ephraim said unto him— What is this thing thou hast done to us, in not calling us, when thou wentest to fight with Midian? And they did chide with him､ sharply.
content_old: 1 And the men of Ephraim said unto him— What is this thing thou hast done to us, in not calling us, when thou wentest to fight with Midian? And they did chide with him､ sharply.

content: 2 And he said unto them, What have I done now､ in comparison with you? Is not the grape-gleaning of Ephraim better than the vintage of Abiezer?
content_old: 2 And he said unto them, What have I done now､ in comparison with you? Is not the grape-gleaning of Ephraim better than the vintage of Abiezer?

content: 3 Into your hand hath God delivered the princes of Midian—Oreb and Zeeb, what then had I been able to do in comparison with you? Then was their spirit softened toward him, when he had spoken this word.
content_old: 3 Into your hand hath God delivered the princes of Midian—Oreb and Zeeb, what then had I been able to do in comparison with you? Then was their spirit softened toward him, when he had spoken this word.

content: 4 And Gideon came towards the Jordan, being about to pass over—he and the three hundred men who were with him, faint yet pursuing.
content_old: 4 And Gideon came towards the Jordan, being about to pass over—he and the three hundred men who were with him, faint yet pursuing.

content: 5 So he said unto the men of Succoth, Give､ I pray you､ loaves of bread to the people that are following me; for faint they are, and I am in pursuit of Zebah and Zalmunna､ kings of Midian.
content_old: 5 So he said unto the men of Succoth, Give､ I pray you､ loaves of bread to the people that are following me; for faint they are, and I am in pursuit of Zebah and Zalmunna､ kings of Midian.

content: 6 And the princes of Succoth said, Are the palms of the hands of Zebah and Zalmunna already in thy power,—that we should give to thine army bread?
content_old: 6 And the princes of Succoth said, Are the palms of the hands of Zebah and Zalmunna already in thy power,—that we should give to thine army bread?

content: 7 And Gideon said, Therefore when Yahweh hath delivered Zebah and Zalmunna into my power then will I tear your flesh with the thorns of the wilderness､ and with the nettles.
content_old: 7 And Gideon said, Therefore when Yahweh hath delivered Zebah and Zalmunna into my power then will I tear your flesh with the thorns of the wilderness､ and with the nettles.

content: 8 So he went up from thence､ to Penuel, and spake unto them in like manner,—and the men of Penuel answered him, as had answered the men of Succoth.
content_old: 8 So he went up from thence､ to Penuel, and spake unto them in like manner,—and the men of Penuel answered him, as had answered the men of Succoth.

content: 9 So he spake to the men of Penuel also､ saying,— When I return with success I will break down this tower.
content_old: 9 So he spake to the men of Penuel also､ saying,— When I return with success I will break down this tower.

content: 10 Now Zebah and Zalmunna were in Karkor､ and their hosts with them､ about fifteen thousand, all that were left out of all the host of the sons of the east,—and the fallen were a hundred and twenty thousand men､ who had drawn the sword.
content_old: 10 Now Zebah and Zalmunna were in Karkor､ and their hosts with them､ about fifteen thousand, all that were left out of all the host of the sons of the east,—and the fallen were a hundred and twenty thousand men､ who had drawn the sword.

content: 11 So Gideon went up by the way of the tent-dwellers, on the east of Nobah and Jogbehah, and smote the host, when the host had become secure.
content_old: 11 So Gideon went up by the way of the tent-dwellers, on the east of Nobah and Jogbehah, and smote the host, when the host had become secure.

content: 12 And when Zebah and Zalmunna fled, then he pursued them, and captured the two kings of Midian—Zebah and Zalmunna, and all the host put he in terror.
content_old: 12 And when Zebah and Zalmunna fled, then he pursued them, and captured the two kings of Midian—Zebah and Zalmunna, and all the host put he in terror.

content: 13 And Gideon son of Joash returned from the battle,—from the ascent of Heres;
content_old: 13 And Gideon son of Joash returned from the battle,—from the ascent of Heres;

content: 14 and caught a young man､ of the men of Succoth､ and enquired of him,—so he wrote down for him the princes of Succoth､ and the elders thereof, seventy-seven men.
content_old: 14 and caught a young man､ of the men of Succoth､ and enquired of him,—so he wrote down for him the princes of Succoth､ and the elders thereof, seventy-seven men.

content: 15 Then came he in unto the men of Succoth, and said, Lo! Zebah and Zalmunna,—concerning whom ye did taunt me､ saying— Are the palms of the hands of Zebah and Zalmunna already in thy power, that we should give to thy weary men bread?
content_old: 15 Then came he in unto the men of Succoth, and said, Lo! Zebah and Zalmunna,—concerning whom ye did taunt me､ saying— Are the palms of the hands of Zebah and Zalmunna already in thy power, that we should give to thy weary men bread?

content: 16 So he took the elders of the city, and the thorns of the wilderness and the nettles, and taught therewith the men of Succoth:
content_old: 16 So he took the elders of the city, and the thorns of the wilderness and the nettles, and taught therewith the men of Succoth:

content: 17 the tower of Penuel also brake he down,—and slew the men of the city.
content_old: 17 the tower of Penuel also brake he down,—and slew the men of the city.

content: 18 Then said he unto Zebah and unto Zalmunna, What manner of men were they, whom ye slew at Tabor? And they said､ As thou art､ so were they, each one as handsome as the sons of a king.
content_old: 18 Then said he unto Zebah and unto Zalmunna, What manner of men were they, whom ye slew at Tabor? And they said､ As thou art､ so were they, each one as handsome as the sons of a king.

content: 19 And he said: My brethren､ sons of my mother they were! As Yahweh liveth if ye had saved them alive I would not have slain you.
content_old: 19 And he said: My brethren､ sons of my mother they were! As Yahweh liveth if ye had saved them alive I would not have slain you.

content: 20 So he said to Jether his firstborn, Up! slay them. But the youth drew not his sword､ for he feared, because he was yet a youth.
content_old: 20 So he said to Jether his firstborn, Up! slay them. But the youth drew not his sword､ for he feared, because he was yet a youth.

content: 21 Then said Zebah and Zalmunna— Up! thou and fall upon us, for like the man is his might. So Gideon arose､ and slew Zebah and Zalmunna, and took the crescents that were on the necks of their camels.
content_old: 21 Then said Zebah and Zalmunna— Up! thou and fall upon us, for like the man is his might. So Gideon arose､ and slew Zebah and Zalmunna, and took the crescents that were on the necks of their camels.

content: 22 Then said the men of Israel､ unto Gideon, Rule over us—even thou､ and thy son､ and thy son’s son,—for thou hast saved us out of the power of Midian.
content_old: 22 Then said the men of Israel､ unto Gideon, Rule over us—even thou､ and thy son､ and thy son’s son,—for thou hast saved us out of the power of Midian.

content: 23 And Gideon said unto them, I will not rule over you, neither shall my son rule over you,— Yahweh shall rule over you.
content_old: 23 And Gideon said unto them, I will not rule over you, neither shall my son rule over you,— Yahweh shall rule over you.

content: 24 And Gideon said unto them— I would make to you a request, Give me､ then､ every man the nose-ring of his spoil. For they had nose-rings of gold for Ishmaelites they were.
content_old: 24 And Gideon said unto them— I would make to you a request, Give me､ then､ every man the nose-ring of his spoil. For they had nose-rings of gold for Ishmaelites they were.

content: 25 And they said, We will freely give. So they spread out a mantle, and cast therein､ every man the nose-ring of his spoil.
content_old: 25 And they said, We will freely give. So they spread out a mantle, and cast therein､ every man the nose-ring of his spoil.
