content: 26 And so it was､ that the weight of the nose-rings of gold which he requested､ was a thousand and seven hundred shekels of gold,—besides the crescents､ and the pendants､ and the raiment of purple that were upon the kings of Midian, and besides the ornaments that were on the necks of their camels.
content_old: 26 And so it was､ that the weight of the nose-rings of gold which he requested､ was a thousand and seven hundred shekels of gold,—besides the crescents､ and the pendants､ and the raiment of purple that were upon the kings of Midian, and besides the ornaments that were on the necks of their camels.

content: 27 And Gideon made thereof an Ephod､ and set it up in his own city､ in Ophrah, and all Israel went unchastely astray after it there,—so it became､ to Gideon and to his house､ a snare.
content_old: 27 And Gideon made thereof an Ephod､ and set it up in his own city､ in Ophrah, and all Israel went unchastely astray after it there,—so it became､ to Gideon and to his house､ a snare.

content: 28 Thus was Midian subdued､ before the sons of Israel, neither did they again lift up their head,—and the land had rest forty years､ in the days of Gideon.
content_old: 28 Thus was Midian subdued､ before the sons of Israel, neither did they again lift up their head,—and the land had rest forty years､ in the days of Gideon.

content: 29 So then Jerubbaal､ son of Joash､ went and dwelt in his own house.
content_old: 29 So then Jerubbaal､ son of Joash､ went and dwelt in his own house.

content: 30 And Gideon had seventy sons, sprung from his own loins,—for many wives had he.
content_old: 30 And Gideon had seventy sons, sprung from his own loins,—for many wives had he.

content: 31 And his concubine who was in Shechem she also bare him a son,—and he gave him the name of Abimelech.
content_old: 31 And his concubine who was in Shechem she also bare him a son,—and he gave him the name of Abimelech.

content: 32 And Gideon､ son of Joash､ died in a good old age,—and was buried in the grave of Joash his father, in Ophrah､ of the Abiezrites.
content_old: 32 And Gideon､ son of Joash､ died in a good old age,—and was buried in the grave of Joash his father, in Ophrah､ of the Abiezrites.

content: 33 And it came to pass that as soon as Gideon was dead the sons of Israel turned back, and went unchastely astray after the Baals,—and appointed them Baal-berith､ to be god:
content_old: 33 And it came to pass that as soon as Gideon was dead the sons of Israel turned back, and went unchastely astray after the Baals,—and appointed them Baal-berith､ to be god:

content: 34 so the sons of Israel remembered not Yahweh､ their own God,—who had rescued them out of the hand of all their enemies､ on every side;
content_old: 34 so the sons of Israel remembered not Yahweh､ their own God,—who had rescued them out of the hand of all their enemies､ on every side;

content: 1 Then went Abimelech son of Jerubbaal､ to Shechem, unto the brethren of his mother,—and spake unto them, and unto all the family of the house of his mother’s father､ saying;
content_old: 1 Then went Abimelech son of Jerubbaal､ to Shechem, unto the brethren of his mother,—and spake unto them, and unto all the family of the house of his mother’s father､ saying;

content: 2 Speak､ I pray you､ in the ears of all the owners of Shechem— Which is better for you, that there should rule over you､ seventy men､ all sons of Jerubbaal, or that there should rule over you､ one man? And remember that your bone and your flesh am I.
content_old: 2 Speak､ I pray you､ in the ears of all the owners of Shechem— Which is better for you, that there should rule over you､ seventy men､ all sons of Jerubbaal, or that there should rule over you､ one man? And remember that your bone and your flesh am I.

content: 3 So the brethren of his mother spake for him､ in the ears of all the owners of Shechem, all these words,—and their heart inclined after Abimelech, for they said— Our own brother is he.
content_old: 3 So the brethren of his mother spake for him､ in the ears of all the owners of Shechem, all these words,—and their heart inclined after Abimelech, for they said— Our own brother is he.

content: 4 So they gave him seventy pieces of silver, out of the house of Baal-berith,—and Abimelech hired therewith､ loose and unstable men, and they followed him.
content_old: 4 So they gave him seventy pieces of silver, out of the house of Baal-berith,—and Abimelech hired therewith､ loose and unstable men, and they followed him.

content: 5 And he entered the house of his father､ at Ophrah, and slew his brethren､ sons of Jerubbaal seventy men､ upon one stone,—but there remained Jotham､ the youngest son of Jerubbaal, for he had hidden himself.
content_old: 5 And he entered the house of his father､ at Ophrah, and slew his brethren､ sons of Jerubbaal seventy men､ upon one stone,—but there remained Jotham､ the youngest son of Jerubbaal, for he had hidden himself.

content: 6 Then were gathered together all the owners of Shechem､ and all the house of Millo, and they went and made Abimelech king,—by the oak of the pillar､ that was in Shechem.
content_old: 6 Then were gathered together all the owners of Shechem､ and all the house of Millo, and they went and made Abimelech king,—by the oak of the pillar､ that was in Shechem.

content: 7 And when it was told Jotham he went and stood on the top of Mount Gerizim, and lifted up his voice､ and cried aloud,—and said unto them— Hearken unto me､ ye owners of Shechem, and may God hearken unto you.
content_old: 7 And when it was told Jotham he went and stood on the top of Mount Gerizim, and lifted up his voice､ and cried aloud,—and said unto them— Hearken unto me､ ye owners of Shechem, and may God hearken unto you.

content: 8 The trees went their way to anoint over them､ a king,—and they said unto the olive tree— Reign thou over us.
content_old: 8 The trees went their way to anoint over them､ a king,—and they said unto the olive tree— Reign thou over us.

content: 9 But the olive tree said unto them, Should I leave my fatness, which in me gods and men do honour,—and go to wave to and fro､ over the trees?
content_old: 9 But the olive tree said unto them, Should I leave my fatness, which in me gods and men do honour,—and go to wave to and fro､ over the trees?

content: 10 Then said the trees unto the fig-tree,— Come! thou reign over us.
content_old: 10 Then said the trees unto the fig-tree,— Come! thou reign over us.

content: 11 But the fig-tree said unto them, Should I leave my sweetness, and mine excellent increase,—and go to wave to and fro､ over the trees?
content_old: 11 But the fig-tree said unto them, Should I leave my sweetness, and mine excellent increase,—and go to wave to and fro､ over the trees?

content: 12 Then said the trees unto the vine,— Come! thou reign over us.
content_old: 12 Then said the trees unto the vine,— Come! thou reign over us.

content: 13 But the vine said unto them, Should I leave my new wine, that rejoiceth gods and men,—and go to wave to and fro､ over the trees?
content_old: 13 But the vine said unto them, Should I leave my new wine, that rejoiceth gods and men,—and go to wave to and fro､ over the trees?

content: 14 Then said all the trees､ unto the bramble,—Come thou to reign over us.
content_old: 14 Then said all the trees､ unto the bramble,—Come thou to reign over us.

content: 15 And the bramble said unto the trees, If in truth ye are about to anoint me to be king over you come､ take refuge in my shade,—but if not there shall come forth fire out of the bramble, and devour the cedars of Lebanon.
content_old: 15 And the bramble said unto the trees, If in truth ye are about to anoint me to be king over you come､ take refuge in my shade,—but if not there shall come forth fire out of the bramble, and devour the cedars of Lebanon.

content: 16 Now therefore､ if in truth and sincerity ye have acted, in making Abimelech king,—and if ye have dealt well with Jerubbaal and with his house, and if according to the deserving of his hands ye have done unto him;
content_old: 16 Now therefore､ if in truth and sincerity ye have acted, in making Abimelech king,—and if ye have dealt well with Jerubbaal and with his house, and if according to the deserving of his hands ye have done unto him;

content: 17 in that my father fought for you, and cast his soul away from before him, and rescued you out of the hand of Midian;—
content_old: 17 in that my father fought for you, and cast his soul away from before him, and rescued you out of the hand of Midian;—

content: 18 yet have ye risen up against the house of my father､ to-day, and slain his sons—seventy men､ upon one stone,—and made Abimelech､ son of his maidservant､ king over the owners of Shechem, because he is your brother;
content_old: 18 yet have ye risen up against the house of my father､ to-day, and slain his sons—seventy men､ upon one stone,—and made Abimelech､ son of his maidservant､ king over the owners of Shechem, because he is your brother;

content: 19 if then in truth and in sincerity ye have dealt with Jerubbaal and with his house､ this day rejoice ye in Abimelech, and let him also rejoice in you;
content_old: 19 if then in truth and in sincerity ye have dealt with Jerubbaal and with his house､ this day rejoice ye in Abimelech, and let him also rejoice in you;

content: 20 but if not let fire come out from Abimelech, and devour the owners of Shechem､ and the house of Millo,—and let fire come out from the owners of Shechem､ and from the house of Millo, and devour Abimelech!
content_old: 20 but if not let fire come out from Abimelech, and devour the owners of Shechem､ and the house of Millo,—and let fire come out from the owners of Shechem､ and from the house of Millo, and devour Abimelech!

content: 21 And Jotham hasted away, and fled､ and went to Beer,—and dwelt there, away from the face of Abimelech his brother.
content_old: 21 And Jotham hasted away, and fled､ and went to Beer,—and dwelt there, away from the face of Abimelech his brother.

content: 22 And Abimelech ruled over Israel three years.
content_old: 22 And Abimelech ruled over Israel three years.

content: 23 Then God let go a spirit of mischief between Abimelech and the owners of Shechem,—and the owners of Shechem dealt treacherously with Abimelech:
content_old: 23 Then God let go a spirit of mischief between Abimelech and the owners of Shechem,—and the owners of Shechem dealt treacherously with Abimelech:

content: 24 that the cruel wrong to the seventy sons of Jerubbaal might come upon them,—and that their blood might be laid upon Abimelech their brother､ who slew them, and upon the owners of Shechem who strengthened his hands､ to slay his brethren.
content_old: 24 that the cruel wrong to the seventy sons of Jerubbaal might come upon them,—and that their blood might be laid upon Abimelech their brother､ who slew them, and upon the owners of Shechem who strengthened his hands､ to slay his brethren.

content: 25 So the owners of Shechem set for him liers in wait､ upon the tops of the mountains, and they robbed all who crossed over them by the road,—and it was told Abimelech.
content_old: 25 So the owners of Shechem set for him liers in wait､ upon the tops of the mountains, and they robbed all who crossed over them by the road,—and it was told Abimelech.

content: 26 And Gaal son of Ebed came､ with his brethren､ and they passed through to Shechem,—and the owners of Shechem put their trust in him.
content_old: 26 And Gaal son of Ebed came､ with his brethren､ and they passed through to Shechem,—and the owners of Shechem put their trust in him.

content: 27 Then went they out into the fields､ and gathered the fruit of their vineyards and trode the grapes, and held a vintage festival,—and entered the house of their god, and did eat and drink､ and poured contempt on Abimelech.
content_old: 27 Then went they out into the fields､ and gathered the fruit of their vineyards and trode the grapes, and held a vintage festival,—and entered the house of their god, and did eat and drink､ and poured contempt on Abimelech.

content: 28 And Gaal son of Ebed said: Who is Abimelech—and who is the son of Shechem､ that we should serve him? Is he not the son of Jerubbaal? and Zebul his officer? Serve ye the men of Hamor､ Shechem’s father, but why should we serve him?
content_old: 28 And Gaal son of Ebed said: Who is Abimelech—and who is the son of Shechem､ that we should serve him? Is he not the son of Jerubbaal? and Zebul his officer? Serve ye the men of Hamor､ Shechem’s father, but why should we serve him?

content: 29 Would､ then､ this people were in my hand! that I might set aside Abimelech,—and say to Abimelech, Increase thine army､ and come out!
content_old: 29 Would､ then､ this people were in my hand! that I might set aside Abimelech,—and say to Abimelech, Increase thine army､ and come out!

content: 30 And when Zubul､ governor of the city､ heard the words of Gaal the son of Ebed then was kindled his anger.
content_old: 30 And when Zubul､ governor of the city､ heard the words of Gaal the son of Ebed then was kindled his anger.

content: 31 And he sent messengers unto Abimelech､ by deceit､ saying,— Lo! Gaal son of Ebed､ and his brethren are coming into Shechem; and lo! are fortifying the city against thee.
content_old: 31 And he sent messengers unto Abimelech､ by deceit､ saying,— Lo! Gaal son of Ebed､ and his brethren are coming into Shechem; and lo! are fortifying the city against thee.

content: 32 Now therefore､ up by night, thou and the people that are with thee and lie in wait in the field;
content_old: 32 Now therefore､ up by night, thou and the people that are with thee and lie in wait in the field;

content: 33 and it shall be in the morning､ about sunrise thou shalt get up early､ and spread thyself out against the city,—when lo! he and the people that are with him coming out against thee, so shalt thou do unto him as thy hand shall find opportunity.
content_old: 33 and it shall be in the morning､ about sunrise thou shalt get up early､ and spread thyself out against the city,—when lo! he and the people that are with him coming out against thee, so shalt thou do unto him as thy hand shall find opportunity.

content: 34 So Abimelech rose up､ and all the people that were with him､ by night,—and they lay in wait above Shechem､ in four companies.
content_old: 34 So Abimelech rose up､ and all the people that were with him､ by night,—and they lay in wait above Shechem､ in four companies.

content: 35 Then came forth Gaal son of Ebed, and took his stand at the opening of the gate of the city,—so Abimelech rose up､ and the people that were with him､ from the place of ambush.
content_old: 35 Then came forth Gaal son of Ebed, and took his stand at the opening of the gate of the city,—so Abimelech rose up､ and the people that were with him､ from the place of ambush.

content: 36 And when Gaal saw the people he said unto Zebul, Lo! people coming down from the tops of the mountains. And Zebul said unto him, The shadow of the mountains thou seest､ like men.
content_old: 36 And when Gaal saw the people he said unto Zebul, Lo! people coming down from the tops of the mountains. And Zebul said unto him, The shadow of the mountains thou seest､ like men.

content: 37 Then did Gaal yet further speak, and say— Lo! people coming down from the highest part of the land,—and one company, coming in by way of the Conjurers’ Terebinth.
content_old: 37 Then did Gaal yet further speak, and say— Lo! people coming down from the highest part of the land,—and one company, coming in by way of the Conjurers’ Terebinth.

content: 38 So then Zebul said unto him— Where､ then､ is thy mouth that kept on saying, Who is Abimelech, that we should serve him? Is not this the people which thou didst despise? Go forth､ I pray thee now､ and fight with them!
content_old: 38 So then Zebul said unto him— Where､ then､ is thy mouth that kept on saying, Who is Abimelech, that we should serve him? Is not this the people which thou didst despise? Go forth､ I pray thee now､ and fight with them!

content: 39 And Gaal went forth before the owners of Shechem,—and fought against Abimelech.
content_old: 39 And Gaal went forth before the owners of Shechem,—and fought against Abimelech.

content: 40 And Abimelech chased him, and he fled before him,—and there fell a multitude of slain as far as the entering of the gate.
content_old: 40 And Abimelech chased him, and he fled before him,—and there fell a multitude of slain as far as the entering of the gate.

content: 41 Then dwelt Abimelech in Arumah､—and Zebul thrust out Gaal and his brethren､ that they should not dwell in Shechem.
content_old: 41 Then dwelt Abimelech in Arumah､—and Zebul thrust out Gaal and his brethren､ that they should not dwell in Shechem.

content: 42 And it came to pass on the morrow that the people went forth into the field,—and they told Abimelech.
content_old: 42 And it came to pass on the morrow that the people went forth into the field,—and they told Abimelech.

content: 43 So he took the people and divided them into three companies, and lay in wait in the field,—and he looked､ and lo! the people coming forth out of the city, so he rose up against them､ and smote them.
content_old: 43 So he took the people and divided them into three companies, and lay in wait in the field,—and he looked､ and lo! the people coming forth out of the city, so he rose up against them､ and smote them.

content: 44 And Abimelech､ and the companies that were with him spread themselves out､ and one of the companies took their stand at the opening of the gate of the city,—while the two companies spread themselves out against all that were in the field､ and smote them.
content_old: 44 And Abimelech､ and the companies that were with him spread themselves out､ and one of the companies took their stand at the opening of the gate of the city,—while the two companies spread themselves out against all that were in the field､ and smote them.

content: 45 And Abimelech fought against the city､ all that day, and captured the city, the people also that were therein he slew,—and brake down the city, and sowed it with salt.
content_old: 45 And Abimelech fought against the city､ all that day, and captured the city, the people also that were therein he slew,—and brake down the city, and sowed it with salt.

content: 46 And when all the owners of the tower of Shechem heard they entered into the basement of the house of El-berith.
content_old: 46 And when all the owners of the tower of Shechem heard they entered into the basement of the house of El-berith.

content: 47 And it was told Abimelech, that all the owners of the tower of Shechem had gathered themselves together.
content_old: 47 And it was told Abimelech, that all the owners of the tower of Shechem had gathered themselves together.

content: 48 So Abimelech went up Mount Zalmon he and all the people that were with him, and Abimelech took an axe in his hand､ and cut down a bough from the trees, and lifted it, and laid it on his shoulder,—and said unto the people that were with him— What ye have seen me do haste! do likewise.
content_old: 48 So Abimelech went up Mount Zalmon he and all the people that were with him, and Abimelech took an axe in his hand､ and cut down a bough from the trees, and lifted it, and laid it on his shoulder,—and said unto the people that were with him— What ye have seen me do haste! do likewise.

content: 49 So､ even all the people cut down every man his bough､ and followed Abimelech､ and laid them over the basement, and set it on fire over them who were therein,—even all the men of the tower of Shechem died､ about a thousand men and women.
content_old: 49 So､ even all the people cut down every man his bough､ and followed Abimelech､ and laid them over the basement, and set it on fire over them who were therein,—even all the men of the tower of Shechem died､ about a thousand men and women.

content: 50 Then went Abimelech unto Thebez,—and encamped against Thebez､ and captured it.
content_old: 50 Then went Abimelech unto Thebez,—and encamped against Thebez､ and captured it.

content: 51 Now a strong tower was in the midst of the city, and there fled thither all the men and the women､ and all the owners of the city, and shut themselves in,—and went up on the roof of the tower.
content_old: 51 Now a strong tower was in the midst of the city, and there fled thither all the men and the women､ and all the owners of the city, and shut themselves in,—and went up on the roof of the tower.

content: 52 And Abimelech came in as far as the tower, and fought against it,—and so came near､ as far as the entrance of the tower､ to burn it with fire.
content_old: 52 And Abimelech came in as far as the tower, and fought against it,—and so came near､ as far as the entrance of the tower､ to burn it with fire.

content: 53 And a certain woman cast an upper millstone upon the head of Abimelech,—and brake in pieces his skull.
content_old: 53 And a certain woman cast an upper millstone upon the head of Abimelech,—and brake in pieces his skull.

content: 54 Then called he hastily unto the young man bearing his armour､ and said unto him— Draw thy sword､ and put me to death, lest they say of me､ A woman slew him! So his young man thrust him through､ and he died.
content_old: 54 Then called he hastily unto the young man bearing his armour､ and said unto him— Draw thy sword､ and put me to death, lest they say of me､ A woman slew him! So his young man thrust him through､ and he died.

content: 55 And when the men of Israel saw that Abimelech was dead they went their way every man to his own place.
content_old: 55 And when the men of Israel saw that Abimelech was dead they went their way every man to his own place.

content: 56 Thus did God requite the wickedness of Abimelech, which he had done to his father, in slaying his seventy brethren;
content_old: 56 Thus did God requite the wickedness of Abimelech, which he had done to his father, in slaying his seventy brethren;

content: 1 And there arose､ after Abimelech､ to save Israel—Tola son of Puah son of Dodo､ a man of Issachar,—and he used to sit in Shamir､ in the hill country of Ephraim;
content_old: 1 And there arose､ after Abimelech､ to save Israel—Tola son of Puah son of Dodo､ a man of Issachar,—and he used to sit in Shamir､ in the hill country of Ephraim;

content: 2 and he judged Israel, twenty-three years,—and died､ and was buried in Shamir.
content_old: 2 and he judged Israel, twenty-three years,—and died､ and was buried in Shamir.

content: 3 And there arose､ after him, Jair the Gileadite,—and judged Israel twenty-two years.
content_old: 3 And there arose､ after him, Jair the Gileadite,—and judged Israel twenty-two years.

content: 4 Now he had thirty sons, that rode on thirty ass colts, and they had thirty cities,—they are called Havvoth-jair､ until this day, which are in the land of Gilead.
content_old: 4 Now he had thirty sons, that rode on thirty ass colts, and they had thirty cities,—they are called Havvoth-jair､ until this day, which are in the land of Gilead.

content: 5 And Jair died, and was buried in Kamon.
content_old: 5 And Jair died, and was buried in Kamon.

content: 6 And the sons of Israel again did the thing that was wicked in the sight of Yahweh, and served the Baals and the Ashtoreths, and the gods of Syria､ and the gods of Zidon､ and the gods of Moab､ and the gods of the sons of Ammon, and the gods of the Philistines,—and forsook Yahweh､ and served him not.
content_old: 6 And the sons of Israel again did the thing that was wicked in the sight of Yahweh, and served the Baals and the Ashtoreths, and the gods of Syria､ and the gods of Zidon､ and the gods of Moab､ and the gods of the sons of Ammon, and the gods of the Philistines,—and forsook Yahweh､ and served him not.

content: 7 So the anger of Yahweh kindled upon Israel,—and he sold them into the hand of the Philistines, and into the hand of the sons of Ammon;
content_old: 7 So the anger of Yahweh kindled upon Israel,—and he sold them into the hand of the Philistines, and into the hand of the sons of Ammon;

content: 8 and they enfeebled and oppressed the sons of Israel in that year,—eighteen years did they this unto all the sons of Israel who were beyond the Jordan, in the land of the Amorite､ that was in Gilead.
content_old: 8 and they enfeebled and oppressed the sons of Israel in that year,—eighteen years did they this unto all the sons of Israel who were beyond the Jordan, in the land of the Amorite､ that was in Gilead.

content: 9 And the sons of Ammon crossed the Jordan, to fight even against Judah and against Benjamin､ and against the house of Ephraim,—so that Israel was sore distressed.
content_old: 9 And the sons of Ammon crossed the Jordan, to fight even against Judah and against Benjamin､ and against the house of Ephraim,—so that Israel was sore distressed.

content: 10 Then did the sons of Israel make outcry unto Yahweh､ saying,— We have sinned against thee, because we have forsaken our God, and have served the Baals.
content_old: 10 Then did the sons of Israel make outcry unto Yahweh､ saying,— We have sinned against thee, because we have forsaken our God, and have served the Baals.

content: 11 Then said Yahweh unto the sons of Israel,— Was it not from the Egyptians､ and from the Amorites, and from the sons of Ammon､ and from the Philistines that I saved you?
content_old: 11 Then said Yahweh unto the sons of Israel,— Was it not from the Egyptians､ and from the Amorites, and from the sons of Ammon､ and from the Philistines that I saved you?

content: 12 The Zidonians also､ and the Amalekites､ and the Maonites oppressed you,—and ye made outcry unto me, and I saved you out of their hand.
content_old: 12 The Zidonians also､ and the Amalekites､ and the Maonites oppressed you,—and ye made outcry unto me, and I saved you out of their hand.

content: 13 Yet have ye forsaken me, and served other gods,—therefore will I not again save you.
content_old: 13 Yet have ye forsaken me, and served other gods,—therefore will I not again save you.

content: 14 Go and make outcry unto the gods whom ye have chosen,—they must save you､ in the time of your tribulation.
content_old: 14 Go and make outcry unto the gods whom ye have chosen,—they must save you､ in the time of your tribulation.

content: 15 And the sons of Israel said unto Yahweh— We have sinned, do thou with us, according to all that is fitting in thine eyes,—only rescue us､ we beseech thee this day.
content_old: 15 And the sons of Israel said unto Yahweh— We have sinned, do thou with us, according to all that is fitting in thine eyes,—only rescue us､ we beseech thee this day.

content: 16 And they put away the gods of the stranger out of their midst, and served Yahweh,—and his soul was impatient of the misery of Israel.
content_old: 16 And they put away the gods of the stranger out of their midst, and served Yahweh,—and his soul was impatient of the misery of Israel.

content: 17 Now the Sons of Ammon were called out, and they encamped in Gilead,—and the sons of Israel assembled themselves together, and encamped in Mizpah.
content_old: 17 Now the Sons of Ammon were called out, and they encamped in Gilead,—and the sons of Israel assembled themselves together, and encamped in Mizpah.

content: 1 Now Jephthah the Gileadite was a mighty man of valour, but he was the son of an unchaste woman,—yet Gilead was the father of Jephthah.
content_old: 1 Now Jephthah the Gileadite was a mighty man of valour, but he was the son of an unchaste woman,—yet Gilead was the father of Jephthah.

content: 2 And the wife of Gilead bare him sons,—and when the wife’s sons grew up they thrust out Jephthah､ and said unto him— Thou shalt not inherit with the house of our father, for son of an alien woman art thou.
content_old: 2 And the wife of Gilead bare him sons,—and when the wife’s sons grew up they thrust out Jephthah､ and said unto him— Thou shalt not inherit with the house of our father, for son of an alien woman art thou.

content: 3 So Jephthah fled from the face of his brethren, and dwelt in the land of Tob,—and there gathered about Jephthah unemployed men､ who went forth with him.
content_old: 3 So Jephthah fled from the face of his brethren, and dwelt in the land of Tob,—and there gathered about Jephthah unemployed men､ who went forth with him.

content: 4 And so it came to pass､ after a time,—that the sons of Ammon made war with Israel.
content_old: 4 And so it came to pass､ after a time,—that the sons of Ammon made war with Israel.

content: 5 When､ therefore､ it came to pass that the sons of Ammon made war with Israel then went the elders of Gilead, to summon Jephthah out of the land of Tob.
content_old: 5 When､ therefore､ it came to pass that the sons of Ammon made war with Israel then went the elders of Gilead, to summon Jephthah out of the land of Tob.

content: 6 And they said to Jephthah, Oh! come and be our commander,—that we may do battle with the sons of Ammon.
content_old: 6 And they said to Jephthah, Oh! come and be our commander,—that we may do battle with the sons of Ammon.

content: 7 But Jephthah said to the elders of Gilead, Have not ye hated me, and thrust me out from the house of my father? Wherefore､ then､ are ye come unto me now, when ye are in distress?
content_old: 7 But Jephthah said to the elders of Gilead, Have not ye hated me, and thrust me out from the house of my father? Wherefore､ then､ are ye come unto me now, when ye are in distress?

content: 8 And the elders of Gilead said unto Jephthah— Therefore have we now returned unto thee, that if thou go with us, and do battle with the sons of Ammon then shalt thou become our head, for all the inhabitants of Gilead.
content_old: 8 And the elders of Gilead said unto Jephthah— Therefore have we now returned unto thee, that if thou go with us, and do battle with the sons of Ammon then shalt thou become our head, for all the inhabitants of Gilead.

content: 9 And Jephthah said unto the elders of Gilead— If ye do bring me back to do battle with the sons of Ammon, and Yahweh deliver them up before me shall I myself become your head?
content_old: 9 And Jephthah said unto the elders of Gilead— If ye do bring me back to do battle with the sons of Ammon, and Yahweh deliver them up before me shall I myself become your head?

content: 10 And the elders of Gilead said unto Jephthah— Yahweh himself will be hearkening between us, if according to thy word so we do not.
content_old: 10 And the elders of Gilead said unto Jephthah— Yahweh himself will be hearkening between us, if according to thy word so we do not.

content: 11 Then went Jephthah with the elders of Gilead, and the people set him over them､ as head and commander,—and Jephthah spake all his words before Yahweh､ in Mizpah.
content_old: 11 Then went Jephthah with the elders of Gilead, and the people set him over them､ as head and commander,—and Jephthah spake all his words before Yahweh､ in Mizpah.

content: 12 So then Jephthah sent messengers unto the king of the sons of Ammon､ saying,— What occasion is there between us, that thou shouldst have come unto me､ to fight against my land?
content_old: 12 So then Jephthah sent messengers unto the king of the sons of Ammon､ saying,— What occasion is there between us, that thou shouldst have come unto me､ to fight against my land?

content: 13 And the king of the sons of Ammon said unto the messengers of Jephthah— Because Israel took away my land､ when they came up out of Egypt, from Arnon even unto the Jabbok､ and unto the Jordan,—now therefore､ restore them in peace.
content_old: 13 And the king of the sons of Ammon said unto the messengers of Jephthah— Because Israel took away my land､ when they came up out of Egypt, from Arnon even unto the Jabbok､ and unto the Jordan,—now therefore､ restore them in peace.

content: 14 And Jephthah yet once more sent messengers unto the king of the sons of Ammon;
content_old: 14 And Jephthah yet once more sent messengers unto the king of the sons of Ammon;

content: 15 and said unto him, Thus saith Jephthah,— Israel took not away the land of Moab, or the land of the sons of Ammon;
content_old: 15 and said unto him, Thus saith Jephthah,— Israel took not away the land of Moab, or the land of the sons of Ammon;

content: 16 for when they came up out of Egypt, and Israel journeyed through the desert as far as the Red Sea, and came in unto Kadesh
content_old: 16 for when they came up out of Egypt, and Israel journeyed through the desert as far as the Red Sea, and came in unto Kadesh

content: 17 then did Israel send messengers unto the king of Edom､ saying— Let me pass､ I pray thee､ through thy land, but the king of Edom hearkened not, unto the king of Moab also sent they､ but he would not consent,—so Israel abode in Kadesh.
content_old: 17 then did Israel send messengers unto the king of Edom､ saying— Let me pass､ I pray thee､ through thy land, but the king of Edom hearkened not, unto the king of Moab also sent they､ but he would not consent,—so Israel abode in Kadesh.

content: 18 Then journeyed they through the desert､ and went round the land of Edom､ and the land of Moab, and so came from the rising of the sun to the land of Moab, but encamped beyond Arnon,—and entered not within the boundary of Moab, for Arnon is the boundary of Moab.
content_old: 18 Then journeyed they through the desert､ and went round the land of Edom､ and the land of Moab, and so came from the rising of the sun to the land of Moab, but encamped beyond Arnon,—and entered not within the boundary of Moab, for Arnon is the boundary of Moab.

content: 19 Then did Israel send messengers unto Sihon king of the Amorites､ king of Heshbon,—and Israel said unto him, Let us pass we pray thee､ through thy land as far as my own place.
content_old: 19 Then did Israel send messengers unto Sihon king of the Amorites､ king of Heshbon,—and Israel said unto him, Let us pass we pray thee､ through thy land as far as my own place.

content: 20 But Sihon trusted not Israel､ to pass through his boundary, so Sihon gathered together all his people, and encamped in Jahaz,—and fought against Israel.
content_old: 20 But Sihon trusted not Israel､ to pass through his boundary, so Sihon gathered together all his people, and encamped in Jahaz,—and fought against Israel.

content: 21 Then did Yahweh､ God of Israel､ deliver up Sihon､ and all his people､ into the hand of Israel､ and they smote them,—so Israel took possession of all the land of the Amorites, the inhabitants of that land.
content_old: 21 Then did Yahweh､ God of Israel､ deliver up Sihon､ and all his people､ into the hand of Israel､ and they smote them,—so Israel took possession of all the land of the Amorites, the inhabitants of that land.

content: 22 Yea they took possession of all the territory of the Amorites,—from Arnon､ even as far as the Jabbok, and from the desert､ even as far as the Jordan.
content_old: 22 Yea they took possession of all the territory of the Amorites,—from Arnon､ even as far as the Jabbok, and from the desert､ even as far as the Jordan.

content: 23 Now therefore､ it was Yahweh God of Israel that dispossessed the Amorites from before his people Israel,—and shalt thou possess it?
content_old: 23 Now therefore､ it was Yahweh God of Israel that dispossessed the Amorites from before his people Israel,—and shalt thou possess it?

content: 24 What Chemosh thy god giveth thee to possess that wilt thou not possess? and whatsoever Yahweh our God hath set before us to possess that shall we not possess?
content_old: 24 What Chemosh thy god giveth thee to possess that wilt thou not possess? and whatsoever Yahweh our God hath set before us to possess that shall we not possess?

content: 25 Now therefore､ art thou really better than Balak son of Zippor､ king of Moab? Hath there been any striving at all with Israel, or any fighting at all with them,
content_old: 25 Now therefore､ art thou really better than Balak son of Zippor､ king of Moab? Hath there been any striving at all with Israel, or any fighting at all with them,

content: 26 all the time that Israel hath been dwelling in Heshbon and in her towns､ and in Aroer and in her towns､ and in all the cities that are on the banks of Arnon,—for three hundred years? Wherefore､ then have ye not made a rescue within that time?
content_old: 26 all the time that Israel hath been dwelling in Heshbon and in her towns､ and in Aroer and in her towns､ and in all the cities that are on the banks of Arnon,—for three hundred years? Wherefore､ then have ye not made a rescue within that time?

content: 27 I､ therefore､ have not sinned against thee; but thou art doing me a wrong､ in fighting against me,— Let Yahweh､ the Judge､ give judgment today, between the sons of Israel､ and the sons of Ammon!
content_old: 27 I､ therefore､ have not sinned against thee; but thou art doing me a wrong､ in fighting against me,— Let Yahweh､ the Judge､ give judgment today, between the sons of Israel､ and the sons of Ammon!

content: 28 But the king of the sons of Ammon hearkened not unto the words of Jephthah､ which he sent unto him.
content_old: 28 But the king of the sons of Ammon hearkened not unto the words of Jephthah､ which he sent unto him.

content: 29 Then came upon Jephthah the spirit of Yahweh, and he passed through Gilead and Manasseh,—and passed through Mizpeh of Gilead, and from Mizpeh of Gilead he passed through unto the sons of Ammon.
content_old: 29 Then came upon Jephthah the spirit of Yahweh, and he passed through Gilead and Manasseh,—and passed through Mizpeh of Gilead, and from Mizpeh of Gilead he passed through unto the sons of Ammon.

content: 30 And Jephthah vowed a vow unto Yahweh, and said,— If thou wilt deliver the sons of Ammon into my hand
content_old: 30 And Jephthah vowed a vow unto Yahweh, and said,— If thou wilt deliver the sons of Ammon into my hand

content: 31 then shall it be, that whosoever cometh forth out of the doors of my house､ to meet me, when I return successful､ from the sons of Ammon shall belong unto Yahweh, and I will offer him up､ as an ascending-sacrifice.
content_old: 31 then shall it be, that whosoever cometh forth out of the doors of my house､ to meet me, when I return successful､ from the sons of Ammon shall belong unto Yahweh, and I will offer him up､ as an ascending-sacrifice.

content: 32 So then Jephthah passed over unto the sons of Ammon､ to fight against them,—and Yahweh delivered them into his hand;
content_old: 32 So then Jephthah passed over unto the sons of Ammon､ to fight against them,—and Yahweh delivered them into his hand;

content: 33 and he smote them､ from Aroer even till thou enterest in to Minnith､ even twenty cities､ and as far as Abel-keramim, with an exceeding great smiting,—and thus were the sons of Ammon subdued before the sons of Israel.
content_old: 33 and he smote them､ from Aroer even till thou enterest in to Minnith､ even twenty cities､ and as far as Abel-keramim, with an exceeding great smiting,—and thus were the sons of Ammon subdued before the sons of Israel.

content: 34 Then came Jephthah towards Mizpah､ unto his own house, and lo! his daughter coming forth to meet him, with timbrels､ and with dances,—and she was none other than his only child, he had not､ besides her､ either son or daughter.
content_old: 34 Then came Jephthah towards Mizpah､ unto his own house, and lo! his daughter coming forth to meet him, with timbrels､ and with dances,—and she was none other than his only child, he had not､ besides her､ either son or daughter.

content: 35 And it came to pass when he saw her that he rent his clothes､ and said— Alas! my daughter, Thou hast brought me low, Even thou hast come to be among them who trouble me,— Yet I opened wide my mouth unto Yahweh, and cannot go back.
content_old: 35 And it came to pass when he saw her that he rent his clothes､ and said— Alas! my daughter, Thou hast brought me low, Even thou hast come to be among them who trouble me,— Yet I opened wide my mouth unto Yahweh, and cannot go back.

content: 36 And she said unto him— My father! Thou hast opened wide thy mouth unto Yahweh, Do with me, according to that which hath gone forth out of thy mouth,— After that Yahweh hath exacted for thee an avenging from thine enemies､ From the sons of Ammon.
content_old: 36 And she said unto him— My father! Thou hast opened wide thy mouth unto Yahweh, Do with me, according to that which hath gone forth out of thy mouth,— After that Yahweh hath exacted for thee an avenging from thine enemies､ From the sons of Ammon.

content: 37 And she said unto her father, Let this thing be done for me,— Let me alone two months､ that I may depart､ and go down upon the mountains, and bewail my virginity, I and my companions.
content_old: 37 And she said unto her father, Let this thing be done for me,— Let me alone two months､ that I may depart､ and go down upon the mountains, and bewail my virginity, I and my companions.

content: 38 And he said— Depart. So he let her go､ for two months,—and she departed､ she and her companions, and bewailed her virginity､ upon the mountains.
content_old: 38 And he said— Depart. So he let her go､ for two months,—and she departed､ she and her companions, and bewailed her virginity､ upon the mountains.

content: 39 And it came to pass､ at the end of two months､ that she returned unto her father, and he fulfilled on her his vow which he had vowed,—she not having known man. And it became a statute､ in Israel:—
content_old: 39 And it came to pass､ at the end of two months､ that she returned unto her father, and he fulfilled on her his vow which he had vowed,—she not having known man. And it became a statute､ in Israel:—

content: 1 And the men of Ephraim were called together, and passed over northward,—and said unto Jephthah— Wherefore didst thou pass over to do battle with the sons of Ammon､ and for us didst not call､ to go with thee? Thy house will we consume over thee with fire.
content_old: 1 And the men of Ephraim were called together, and passed over northward,—and said unto Jephthah— Wherefore didst thou pass over to do battle with the sons of Ammon､ and for us didst not call､ to go with thee? Thy house will we consume over thee with fire.

content: 2 And Jephthah said unto them, Great strife had I and my people even with the sons of Ammon; but when I cried unto you for help ye saved me not out of their hand.
content_old: 2 And Jephthah said unto them, Great strife had I and my people even with the sons of Ammon; but when I cried unto you for help ye saved me not out of their hand.

content: 3 So when I saw that thou wast not going to save then put I my life in my hand､ and passed over against the sons of Ammon, and Yahweh delivered them into my hand. Wherefore､ then､ have ye come up against me this day､ to fight against me?
content_old: 3 So when I saw that thou wast not going to save then put I my life in my hand､ and passed over against the sons of Ammon, and Yahweh delivered them into my hand. Wherefore､ then､ have ye come up against me this day､ to fight against me?

content: 4 And Jephthah gathered together all the men of Gilead, and fought with Ephraim,—and the men of Gilead smote Ephraim､ because they said— Fugitives of Ephraim are ye､ O ye Gileadites､ in the midst of Ephraim､ in the midst of Manasseh.
content_old: 4 And Jephthah gathered together all the men of Gilead, and fought with Ephraim,—and the men of Gilead smote Ephraim､ because they said— Fugitives of Ephraim are ye､ O ye Gileadites､ in the midst of Ephraim､ in the midst of Manasseh.

content: 5 And the Gileadites captured the fords of the Jordan､ against the Ephraimites,—and so it was､ that when the fugitives of Ephraim said､ Let me pass over the men of Gilead said to him､ An Ephraimite art thou? and if he said— Nay!
content_old: 5 And the Gileadites captured the fords of the Jordan､ against the Ephraimites,—and so it was､ that when the fugitives of Ephraim said､ Let me pass over the men of Gilead said to him､ An Ephraimite art thou? and if he said— Nay!

content: 6 they said to him､ Come now､ say Shibboleth, and if he said Sibboleth､ and he could not take heed to speak in that manner then laid they hold on him, and slew him at the fords of the Jordan,—and there fell at that time of the Ephraimites, forty-two thousand.
content_old: 6 they said to him､ Come now､ say Shibboleth, and if he said Sibboleth､ and he could not take heed to speak in that manner then laid they hold on him, and slew him at the fords of the Jordan,—and there fell at that time of the Ephraimites, forty-two thousand.

content: 7 And when Jephthah had judged Israel six years then Jephthah the Gileadite died, and was buried in one of the cities of Gilead.
content_old: 7 And when Jephthah had judged Israel six years then Jephthah the Gileadite died, and was buried in one of the cities of Gilead.

content: 8 And there judged Israel､ after him､ Ibzan of Bethlehem.
content_old: 8 And there judged Israel､ after him､ Ibzan of Bethlehem.

content: 9 And so it was､ he had thirty sons, and thirty daughters sent he abroad, while thirty daughters brought he from abroad for his sons. And he judged Israel seven years.
content_old: 9 And so it was､ he had thirty sons, and thirty daughters sent he abroad, while thirty daughters brought he from abroad for his sons. And he judged Israel seven years.

content: 10 And Ibzan died, and was buried in Bethlehem.
content_old: 10 And Ibzan died, and was buried in Bethlehem.

content: 11 And､ after him､ did Elon the Zebulunite judge Israel,—and he judged Israel､ ten years.
content_old: 11 And､ after him､ did Elon the Zebulunite judge Israel,—and he judged Israel､ ten years.

content: 12 And Elon the Zebulunite died, and was buried in Aijalon､ in the land of Zebulun.
content_old: 12 And Elon the Zebulunite died, and was buried in Aijalon､ in the land of Zebulun.

content: 13 And there judged Israel､ after him､ Abdôn son of Hillel､ the Pirathonite.
content_old: 13 And there judged Israel､ after him､ Abdôn son of Hillel､ the Pirathonite.

content: 14 And so it was､ he had forty sons and thirty grandsons, who rode on seventy ass colts,—and he judged Israel eight years.
content_old: 14 And so it was､ he had forty sons and thirty grandsons, who rode on seventy ass colts,—and he judged Israel eight years.

content: 1 And the sons of Israel again did the thing that was wicked in the sight of Yahweh,—so Yahweh delivered them up into the hand of the Philistines､ forty years.
content_old: 1 And the sons of Israel again did the thing that was wicked in the sight of Yahweh,—so Yahweh delivered them up into the hand of the Philistines､ forty years.

content: 2 And there was a certain man of Zorah､ of the family of the Danites､ and his name was Manoah; and his wife was barren､ and had borne no child.
content_old: 2 And there was a certain man of Zorah､ of the family of the Danites､ and his name was Manoah; and his wife was barren､ and had borne no child.

content: 3 And the messenger of Yahweh appeared unto the woman,—and said unto her— Lo! I pray thee､ thou art barren､ and hast borne no child, but thou shalt conceive､ and shalt bear a son.
content_old: 3 And the messenger of Yahweh appeared unto the woman,—and said unto her— Lo! I pray thee､ thou art barren､ and hast borne no child, but thou shalt conceive､ and shalt bear a son.

content: 4 Now therefore､ beware､ I pray thee､ and do not drink wine or strong drink,—nor eat anything unclean;
content_old: 4 Now therefore､ beware､ I pray thee､ and do not drink wine or strong drink,—nor eat anything unclean;

content: 5 for lo! thou art about to conceive and bear a son､ and no razor shall come on his head, for one separate unto God shall the boy be from his birth､—and he shall begin to save Israel out of the hand of the Philistines.
content_old: 5 for lo! thou art about to conceive and bear a son､ and no razor shall come on his head, for one separate unto God shall the boy be from his birth､—and he shall begin to save Israel out of the hand of the Philistines.

content: 6 So the woman came in､ and told her husband､ saying, A man of God came unto me､ and his appearance was as the appearance of the messenger of God､ reverend exceedingly,—and I asked him not whence he was, and his name he told me not.
content_old: 6 So the woman came in､ and told her husband､ saying, A man of God came unto me､ and his appearance was as the appearance of the messenger of God､ reverend exceedingly,—and I asked him not whence he was, and his name he told me not.

content: 7 But he said unto me, Lo! thou art about to conceive､ and bear a son,—now therefore､ do not drink wine or strong drink､ nor eat anything unclean, for one separate unto God shall the boy be, from his birth until the day of his death.
content_old: 7 But he said unto me, Lo! thou art about to conceive､ and bear a son,—now therefore､ do not drink wine or strong drink､ nor eat anything unclean, for one separate unto God shall the boy be, from his birth until the day of his death.

content: 8 Then Manoah made entreaty unto Yahweh､ and said: Pardon､ O My Lord! the man of God whom thou didst send I pray thee､ let him come again unto us, that he may teach us what we are to do､ unto the boy that is to be born.
content_old: 8 Then Manoah made entreaty unto Yahweh､ and said: Pardon､ O My Lord! the man of God whom thou didst send I pray thee､ let him come again unto us, that he may teach us what we are to do､ unto the boy that is to be born.

content: 9 And God hearkened unto the voice of Manoah,—and the messenger of God came again unto the woman､ as she was sitting in the field, Manoah her husband not being with her.
content_old: 9 And God hearkened unto the voice of Manoah,—and the messenger of God came again unto the woman､ as she was sitting in the field, Manoah her husband not being with her.

content: 10 So the woman made haste､ and ran､ and told her husband,—and said unto him, Lo! the man hath appeared unto me, who came the other day unto me.
content_old: 10 So the woman made haste､ and ran､ and told her husband,—and said unto him, Lo! the man hath appeared unto me, who came the other day unto me.

content: 11 Then Manoah arose､ and followed his wife,—and came unto the man, and said unto him— Art thou the man that spake unto the wife? And he said— I am.
content_old: 11 Then Manoah arose､ and followed his wife,—and came unto the man, and said unto him— Art thou the man that spake unto the wife? And he said— I am.

content: 12 And Manoah said, Now let thy words come to pass,— What shall be the rule for the boy､ and his work?
content_old: 12 And Manoah said, Now let thy words come to pass,— What shall be the rule for the boy､ and his work?

content: 13 And the messenger of Yahweh said unto Manoah,— Of all that I said unto the woman let her beware.
content_old: 13 And the messenger of Yahweh said unto Manoah,— Of all that I said unto the woman let her beware.

content: 14 Of nothing that cometh of the vine may she eat､ nor wine nor strong drink let her drink, nor anything unclean let her eat,—all that I commanded her let her observe.
content_old: 14 Of nothing that cometh of the vine may she eat､ nor wine nor strong drink let her drink, nor anything unclean let her eat,—all that I commanded her let her observe.

content: 15 And Manoah said unto the messenger of Yahweh,— I pray thee､ let us detain thee, that we may make ready for thy presence､ a kid.
content_old: 15 And Manoah said unto the messenger of Yahweh,— I pray thee､ let us detain thee, that we may make ready for thy presence､ a kid.

content: 16 But the messenger of Yahweh said unto Manoah— Though thou detain me yet will I not eat of thy food, and though thou make ready an ascending-sacrifice unto Yahweh must thou cause it to ascend. For Manoah had not discerned that the angel of Yahweh he was.
content_old: 16 But the messenger of Yahweh said unto Manoah— Though thou detain me yet will I not eat of thy food, and though thou make ready an ascending-sacrifice unto Yahweh must thou cause it to ascend. For Manoah had not discerned that the angel of Yahweh he was.

content: 17 Then said Manoah unto the messenger of Yahweh､ What is thy name,—that when thy word cometh to pass we may do thee honour?
content_old: 17 Then said Manoah unto the messenger of Yahweh､ What is thy name,—that when thy word cometh to pass we may do thee honour?

content: 18 And the messenger of Yahweh said unto him, Wherefore is it､ that thou shouldst ask after my name,—seeing that it is Wonderful?
content_old: 18 And the messenger of Yahweh said unto him, Wherefore is it､ that thou shouldst ask after my name,—seeing that it is Wonderful?

content: 19 So Manoah took the kid､ and the meal-offering, and caused them to ascend upon the rock unto Yahweh, who was about to do wondróusly, while Manoah and his wife were looking on.
content_old: 19 So Manoah took the kid､ and the meal-offering, and caused them to ascend upon the rock unto Yahweh, who was about to do wondróusly, while Manoah and his wife were looking on.

content: 20 And it came to pass when the flame ascended from off the altar､ towards the heavens that the messenger of Yahweh ascended in the flame of the altar,—while Manoah and his wife were looking on. Then fell they on their faces､ to the earth.
content_old: 20 And it came to pass when the flame ascended from off the altar､ towards the heavens that the messenger of Yahweh ascended in the flame of the altar,—while Manoah and his wife were looking on. Then fell they on their faces､ to the earth.

content: 21 And the messenger of Yahweh did no more appear unto Manoah or unto his wife. Then Manoah knew that the messenger of Yahweh he was.
content_old: 21 And the messenger of Yahweh did no more appear unto Manoah or unto his wife. Then Manoah knew that the messenger of Yahweh he was.

content: 22 And Manoah said unto his wife､ We shall die､—for upon God have we looked.
content_old: 22 And Manoah said unto his wife､ We shall die､—for upon God have we looked.

content: 23 But his wife said unto him､ If Yahweh had been pleased to put us to death he would not have received at our hand､ an ascending-sacrifice and a meal-offering, nor would he have shewed us all these things,—and at such a time have let us hear the like of this!
content_old: 23 But his wife said unto him､ If Yahweh had been pleased to put us to death he would not have received at our hand､ an ascending-sacrifice and a meal-offering, nor would he have shewed us all these things,—and at such a time have let us hear the like of this!

content: 24 So the woman bare a son, and called his name Samson,—and the boy grew, and Yahweh blessed him.
content_old: 24 So the woman bare a son, and called his name Samson,—and the boy grew, and Yahweh blessed him.

content: 1 And Samson went down to Timnath,—and saw a woman in Timnath､ of the daughters of the Philistines.
content_old: 1 And Samson went down to Timnath,—and saw a woman in Timnath､ of the daughters of the Philistines.

content: 2 So he came up､ and told his father and his mother, and said— A woman have I seen in Timnath､ of the daughters of the Philistines,—now therefore､ take her for me､ to wife.
content_old: 2 So he came up､ and told his father and his mother, and said— A woman have I seen in Timnath､ of the daughters of the Philistines,—now therefore､ take her for me､ to wife.

content: 3 And his father and his mother said to him— Is there not､ among the daughters of thy brethren､ or among all my people､ a woman, that thou art going away to take a woman from among the uncircumcised Philistines? But Samson said unto his father— Take her for me, for she is pleasant in mine eyes.
content_old: 3 And his father and his mother said to him— Is there not､ among the daughters of thy brethren､ or among all my people､ a woman, that thou art going away to take a woman from among the uncircumcised Philistines? But Samson said unto his father— Take her for me, for she is pleasant in mine eyes.

content: 4 Now his father and his mother knew not､ that from Yahweh it was, that an occasion he was seeking of the Philistines,—at that time the Philistines having dominion over Israel.
content_old: 4 Now his father and his mother knew not､ that from Yahweh it was, that an occasion he was seeking of the Philistines,—at that time the Philistines having dominion over Israel.

content: 5 So Samson went down､ and his father and his mother､ to Timnath,—and they came as far as the vineyards of Timnath, when lo! a young lion roaring to meet him.
content_old: 5 So Samson went down､ and his father and his mother､ to Timnath,—and they came as far as the vineyards of Timnath, when lo! a young lion roaring to meet him.

content: 6 And the Spirit of Yahweh came suddenly over him､ and he tore it in pieces as if he had torn in pieces a kid, there being nothing at all in his hand,—but he told not his father or his mother what he had done.
content_old: 6 And the Spirit of Yahweh came suddenly over him､ and he tore it in pieces as if he had torn in pieces a kid, there being nothing at all in his hand,—but he told not his father or his mother what he had done.

content: 7 So he went down､ and spake unto the woman,—and she was pleasant in the eyes of Samson.
content_old: 7 So he went down､ and spake unto the woman,—and she was pleasant in the eyes of Samson.

content: 8 And he returned､ after a time､ to take her, and went aside to see the carcase of the lion,—and lo! a swarm of bees in the body of the lion､ and honey,
content_old: 8 And he returned､ after a time､ to take her, and went aside to see the carcase of the lion,—and lo! a swarm of bees in the body of the lion､ and honey,

content: 9 which he took into his hands, and went on—eating as he went, and came unto his father and unto his mother, and gave unto them､ and they did eat,—but he told them not that out of the carcase of the lion he had taken the honey.
content_old: 9 which he took into his hands, and went on—eating as he went, and came unto his father and unto his mother, and gave unto them､ and they did eat,—but he told them not that out of the carcase of the lion he had taken the honey.

content: 10 And his father went down unto the woman,—and Samson made there a banquet, for so used the young men to do.
content_old: 10 And his father went down unto the woman,—and Samson made there a banquet, for so used the young men to do.

content: 11 And it came to pass because they feared him that they took thirty companions, who remained with him.
content_old: 11 And it came to pass because they feared him that they took thirty companions, who remained with him.

content: 12 And Samson said unto them, I pray you let me put you forth a riddle,—if ye tell it me､ within the seven days of the banquet､ and find it out then will I give you thirty linen wraps and thirty changes of raiment;
content_old: 12 And Samson said unto them, I pray you let me put you forth a riddle,—if ye tell it me､ within the seven days of the banquet､ and find it out then will I give you thirty linen wraps and thirty changes of raiment;

content: 13 but if ye cannot tell me then shall ye give me thirty linen wraps, and thirty changes of raiment. And they said unto him, Put forth thy riddle､ that we may hear it.
content_old: 13 but if ye cannot tell me then shall ye give me thirty linen wraps, and thirty changes of raiment. And they said unto him, Put forth thy riddle､ that we may hear it.

content: 14 And he said to them— Out of the eater came forth food, And out of the strong came forth sweetness. But they could not tell the riddle､ in three days.
content_old: 14 And he said to them— Out of the eater came forth food, And out of the strong came forth sweetness. But they could not tell the riddle､ in three days.

content: 15 And it came to pass on the fourth day that they said to Samson’s wife､ Entice thy husband, that he may tell us the riddle, lest we burn thee and the house of thy father､ with fire. Was it not to impoverish us that ye invited us—was it not?
content_old: 15 And it came to pass on the fourth day that they said to Samson’s wife､ Entice thy husband, that he may tell us the riddle, lest we burn thee and the house of thy father､ with fire. Was it not to impoverish us that ye invited us—was it not?

content: 16 And the wife of Samson wept upon him､ and said— Thou dost altogether hate me､ and dost not love me, a riddle hast thou put forth to the sons of my people, and unto me thou hast not told it! And he said to her, Lo! to my own father and mother have I not told it､ and to thee shall I tell it?
content_old: 16 And the wife of Samson wept upon him､ and said— Thou dost altogether hate me､ and dost not love me, a riddle hast thou put forth to the sons of my people, and unto me thou hast not told it! And he said to her, Lo! to my own father and mother have I not told it､ and to thee shall I tell it?

content: 17 So she wept upon him the seven days,—while their banquet lasted,—and it came to pass on the seventh day that he told her､ because she urged him, and she told the riddle unto the sons of her people.
content_old: 17 So she wept upon him the seven days,—while their banquet lasted,—and it came to pass on the seventh day that he told her､ because she urged him, and she told the riddle unto the sons of her people.

content: 18 And the men of the city said to him､ on the seventh day—ere yet the sun went in What is sweeter than honey? And what is stronger than a lion? And he said to them: If ye had not ploughed with my heifer Ye had not found out my riddle!
content_old: 18 And the men of the city said to him､ on the seventh day—ere yet the sun went in What is sweeter than honey? And what is stronger than a lion? And he said to them: If ye had not ploughed with my heifer Ye had not found out my riddle!

content: 19 And the Spirit of Yahweh came suddenly over him､ and he went down to Ashkelon､ and smote of them thirty men､ and took their garments, and gave the changes of raiment to them who had told the riddle,—and his anger was kindled, and he went up to his father’s house.
content_old: 19 And the Spirit of Yahweh came suddenly over him､ and he went down to Ashkelon､ and smote of them thirty men､ and took their garments, and gave the changes of raiment to them who had told the riddle,—and his anger was kindled, and he went up to his father’s house.

content: 1 And it came to pass after a time､ in the days of wheat-harvest that Samson went to visit his wife､ with a kid, and he said— I will go in unto my wife､ in the chamber. But her father would not suffer him to go in.
content_old: 1 And it came to pass after a time､ in the days of wheat-harvest that Samson went to visit his wife､ with a kid, and he said— I will go in unto my wife､ in the chamber. But her father would not suffer him to go in.

content: 2 And her father said— I thought that thou didst hate her, so I gave her to thy companion,— Is not her younger sister fairer than she? Pray let her be thine､ in her stead.
content_old: 2 And her father said— I thought that thou didst hate her, so I gave her to thy companion,— Is not her younger sister fairer than she? Pray let her be thine､ in her stead.

content: 3 And Samson said of them, I shall be more blameless､ this time､ than the Philistines,—though I should do them a mischief.
content_old: 3 And Samson said of them, I shall be more blameless､ this time､ than the Philistines,—though I should do them a mischief.

content: 4 So Samson Went, and caught three hundred jackals,—and took torches､ and turned tail to tail, and put one torch between the two tails､ in the midst.
content_old: 4 So Samson Went, and caught three hundred jackals,—and took torches､ and turned tail to tail, and put one torch between the two tails､ in the midst.

content: 5 And､ when he had set fire to the torches､ he let them go into the standing corn of the Philistines,—and set fire､ both to the stack of sheaves and to the standing corn､ and besides to the olive plantation.
content_old: 5 And､ when he had set fire to the torches､ he let them go into the standing corn of the Philistines,—and set fire､ both to the stack of sheaves and to the standing corn､ and besides to the olive plantation.

content: 6 Then said the Philistines�� Who hath done this? And they said— Samson､ son-in-law of the Timnite, because he hath taken his wife､ and given her to his companion. So the Philistines went up and burned her and her father､ with fire.
content_old: 6 Then said the Philistines�� Who hath done this? And they said— Samson､ son-in-law of the Timnite, because he hath taken his wife､ and given her to his companion. So the Philistines went up and burned her and her father､ with fire.

content: 7 And Samson said to them, Though ye do the like of this yet will I be avenged upon you､ and afterwards will I cease.
content_old: 7 And Samson said to them, Though ye do the like of this yet will I be avenged upon you､ and afterwards will I cease.

content: 8 So he smote them､ leg on thigh､ with a great smiting,—and went down and dwelt in a cleft of the crag Etam.
content_old: 8 So he smote them､ leg on thigh､ with a great smiting,—and went down and dwelt in a cleft of the crag Etam.

content: 9 Then went up the Philistines, and encamped in Judah,—and were spread abroad in Lehi.
content_old: 9 Then went up the Philistines, and encamped in Judah,—and were spread abroad in Lehi.

content: 10 And the men of Judah said, Wherefore have ye come up against us? And they said— To bind Samson are we come up, to do unto him as he hath done unto us.
content_old: 10 And the men of Judah said, Wherefore have ye come up against us? And they said— To bind Samson are we come up, to do unto him as he hath done unto us.

content: 11 Then went down three thousand men out of Judah､ unto the cleft of the crag Etam, and said unto Samson— Knowest thou not that the Philistines are lording it over us? What､ then､ is this thou hast done to us? And he said unto them, As they have done to me so have I done to them.
content_old: 11 Then went down three thousand men out of Judah､ unto the cleft of the crag Etam, and said unto Samson— Knowest thou not that the Philistines are lording it over us? What､ then､ is this thou hast done to us? And he said unto them, As they have done to me so have I done to them.

content: 12 And they said to him— To bind thee are we come down, to deliver thee into the hand of the Philistines. And Samson said to them, Swear to me､ that ye will not fall upon me yourselves.
content_old: 12 And they said to him— To bind thee are we come down, to deliver thee into the hand of the Philistines. And Samson said to them, Swear to me､ that ye will not fall upon me yourselves.

content: 13 And they answered him､ saying— Nay; but we will bind thee､ and deliver thee into their hand, but we will not put thee to death. So they bound him with two new ropes, and took him up from the crag.
content_old: 13 And they answered him､ saying— Nay; but we will bind thee､ and deliver thee into their hand, but we will not put thee to death. So they bound him with two new ropes, and took him up from the crag.

content: 14 He was coming in as far as Lehi, and the Philistines came shouting to meet him,—when the Spirit of Yahweh came suddenly over him､ and the ropes that were upon his arms became as threads of flax which have been ignited with fire, so that his bonds melted from off his hands.
content_old: 14 He was coming in as far as Lehi, and the Philistines came shouting to meet him,—when the Spirit of Yahweh came suddenly over him､ and the ropes that were upon his arms became as threads of flax which have been ignited with fire, so that his bonds melted from off his hands.

content: 15 Then found he the jawbone of an ass newly-slain,—so he thrust forth his hand､ and took it, and smote therewith a thousand men.
content_old: 15 Then found he the jawbone of an ass newly-slain,—so he thrust forth his hand､ and took it, and smote therewith a thousand men.

content: 16 And Samson said, With the jawbone of an ass— Have I piled them up in heaps! With the jawbone of an ass Have I smitten a thousand men!
content_old: 16 And Samson said, With the jawbone of an ass— Have I piled them up in heaps! With the jawbone of an ass Have I smitten a thousand men!

content: 17 And it came to pass when he had made an end of speaking that he cast away the jawbone out of his hand,—and called the name of that place､ Ramath-lehi.
content_old: 17 And it came to pass when he had made an end of speaking that he cast away the jawbone out of his hand,—and called the name of that place､ Ramath-lehi.

content: 18 And he was sore athirst, so he cried unto Yahweh､ and said, Thou thyself hast given､ into the hand of thy servant､ this great salvation,—and now must I die of thirst, and fall into the hand of the uncircumcised?
content_old: 18 And he was sore athirst, so he cried unto Yahweh､ and said, Thou thyself hast given､ into the hand of thy servant､ this great salvation,—and now must I die of thirst, and fall into the hand of the uncircumcised?

content: 19 So then God clave open the hollow that is in Lehi, and there came therefrom water､ and he drank, and his spirit came back､ and he revived,—for this cause called he the name thereof—Ain-hakkore, which is in Lehi､ until this day.
content_old: 19 So then God clave open the hollow that is in Lehi, and there came therefrom water､ and he drank, and his spirit came back､ and he revived,—for this cause called he the name thereof—Ain-hakkore, which is in Lehi､ until this day.

content: 1 Then went Samson unto Gaza,—and saw there an unchaste woman, and went in unto her.
content_old: 1 Then went Samson unto Gaza,—and saw there an unchaste woman, and went in unto her.

content: 2 And it was told the Gazites､ saying— Samson hath come in hither. So they came round､ and lay in wait for him, all the night､ in the gate of the city,—but kept themselves quiet all the night､ saying, Until the light of the morning then will we slay him.
content_old: 2 And it was told the Gazites､ saying— Samson hath come in hither. So they came round､ and lay in wait for him, all the night､ in the gate of the city,—but kept themselves quiet all the night､ saying, Until the light of the morning then will we slay him.

content: 3 And Samson lay till midnight､ and arose at midnight, and took hold of the doors of the gate of the city､ and of the two doorposts, and tare them away､ with the bar, and put them on his shoulders,—and carried them up to the top of the hill that faceth Hebron.
content_old: 3 And Samson lay till midnight､ and arose at midnight, and took hold of the doors of the gate of the city､ and of the two doorposts, and tare them away､ with the bar, and put them on his shoulders,—and carried them up to the top of the hill that faceth Hebron.

content: 4 And it came to pass､ after this､ that he loved a woman in the ravine of Shorek, whose name was Delilah.
content_old: 4 And it came to pass､ after this､ that he loved a woman in the ravine of Shorek, whose name was Delilah.

content: 5 So the lords of the Philistines came up unto her､ and said to her— Entice him､ and see wherein lieth his great strength, and wherewith we may prevail against him, and bind him､ to humble him,—and we will give thee､ every man､ eleven hundred pieces of silver.
content_old: 5 So the lords of the Philistines came up unto her､ and said to her— Entice him､ and see wherein lieth his great strength, and wherewith we may prevail against him, and bind him､ to humble him,—and we will give thee､ every man､ eleven hundred pieces of silver.

content: 6 So Delilah said unto Samson, Do tell me､ I pray thee､ wherein lieth thy great strength,—and wherewith thou mightest be bound､ to humble thee.
content_old: 6 So Delilah said unto Samson, Do tell me､ I pray thee､ wherein lieth thy great strength,—and wherewith thou mightest be bound､ to humble thee.

content: 7 And Samson said unto her, If they bind me with seven green cords､ that have not been dried then shall I become weak､ and be as any other man.
content_old: 7 And Samson said unto her, If they bind me with seven green cords､ that have not been dried then shall I become weak､ and be as any other man.

content: 8 So the lords of the Philistines brought up to her seven green cords､ that had not been dried,—and she bound him therewith.
content_old: 8 So the lords of the Philistines brought up to her seven green cords､ that had not been dried,—and she bound him therewith.

content: 9 Now the liers in wait were tarrying for her､ in an inner chamber,—and she said unto him,— The Philistines are upon thee､ Samson! And he snapped the cords as a thread of tow is broken､ when fire bloweth thereon, so his strength was not discovered.
content_old: 9 Now the liers in wait were tarrying for her､ in an inner chamber,—and she said unto him,— The Philistines are upon thee､ Samson! And he snapped the cords as a thread of tow is broken､ when fire bloweth thereon, so his strength was not discovered.

content: 10 And Delilah said unto Samson, Lo! thou hast been laughing at me, and speaking unto me falsehoods,—Now do tell me､ I pray thee､ wherewith thou mightest be bound.
content_old: 10 And Delilah said unto Samson, Lo! thou hast been laughing at me, and speaking unto me falsehoods,—Now do tell me､ I pray thee､ wherewith thou mightest be bound.

content: 11 And he said unto her, If they bind me fast with new ropes､ wherewith work was never done then shall I become weak, and be as any other man.
content_old: 11 And he said unto her, If they bind me fast with new ropes､ wherewith work was never done then shall I become weak, and be as any other man.

content: 12 So Delilah took new ropes､ and bound him therewith､ and said unto him— The Philistines are upon thee､ Samson! Now the liers in wait were tarrying in an inner chamber. And he snapped them off his arms like a thread.
content_old: 12 So Delilah took new ropes､ and bound him therewith､ and said unto him— The Philistines are upon thee､ Samson! Now the liers in wait were tarrying in an inner chamber. And he snapped them off his arms like a thread.

content: 13 And Delilah said unto Samson— Hitherto hast thou been laughing at me, and speaking unto me falsehoods, do tell me, wherewith thou mightest be bound. And he said unto her, If thou weave the seven braids of my head with the warp
content_old: 13 And Delilah said unto Samson— Hitherto hast thou been laughing at me, and speaking unto me falsehoods, do tell me, wherewith thou mightest be bound. And he said unto her, If thou weave the seven braids of my head with the warp

content: 14 So she beat them up with the pin, and said unto him, The Philistines are upon thee､ Samson! And he awaked out of his sleep, and pulled out the pin of the loom､ and the warp.
content_old: 14 So she beat them up with the pin, and said unto him, The Philistines are upon thee､ Samson! And he awaked out of his sleep, and pulled out the pin of the loom､ and the warp.

content: 15 And she said unto him— How canst thou say､ I love thee, when thy heart is not with me? These three times hast thou laughed at me, and hast not told me wherein lieth thy great strength.
content_old: 15 And she said unto him— How canst thou say､ I love thee, when thy heart is not with me? These three times hast thou laughed at me, and hast not told me wherein lieth thy great strength.

content: 16 And it came to pass when she urged him with her words continually､ and pressed him that his soul became impatient､ unto death;
content_old: 16 And it came to pass when she urged him with her words continually､ and pressed him that his soul became impatient､ unto death;

content: 17 so he told her all his heart､ and said to her— No razor hath come on my head, for one separate unto God have I been､ from my birth,—if I were shaven then would depart from me my strength, and I should become weak､ and be as any other man.
content_old: 17 so he told her all his heart､ and said to her— No razor hath come on my head, for one separate unto God have I been､ from my birth,—if I were shaven then would depart from me my strength, and I should become weak､ and be as any other man.

content: 18 And when Delilah saw that he had told her all his heart she sent and called for the lords of the Philistines､ saying— Come up this once, for he hath told me all his heart. And the lords of the Philistines came up unto her, and brought up the silver in their hand.
content_old: 18 And when Delilah saw that he had told her all his heart she sent and called for the lords of the Philistines､ saying— Come up this once, for he hath told me all his heart. And the lords of the Philistines came up unto her, and brought up the silver in their hand.

content: 19 And she made him sleep upon her knees, and called for a man, and caused him to shave off the seven braids of his head,—and she began to humble him, and his strength departed from him.
content_old: 19 And she made him sleep upon her knees, and called for a man, and caused him to shave off the seven braids of his head,—and she began to humble him, and his strength departed from him.

content: 20 And she said— The Philistines are upon thee､ Samson! And he awoke out of his sleep､ and said— I will go out now､ as time after time､ and shake myself free: he not knowing､ that Yahweh had departed from him.
content_old: 20 And she said— The Philistines are upon thee､ Samson! And he awoke out of his sleep､ and said— I will go out now､ as time after time､ and shake myself free: he not knowing､ that Yahweh had departed from him.

content: 21 And the Philistines seized him, and put out his eyes,—and took him down to Gaza､ and bound him with fetters of bronze, and it came to pass that he used to grind in the prison.
content_old: 21 And the Philistines seized him, and put out his eyes,—and took him down to Gaza､ and bound him with fetters of bronze, and it came to pass that he used to grind in the prison.

content: 22 And the hair of his head began to grow､ after he had been shaven.
content_old: 22 And the hair of his head began to grow､ after he had been shaven.

content: 23 Now the lords of the Philistines had gathered themselves together to offer a great sacrifice unto Dagon their god､ and to rejoice,—and they said, Our god hath delivered into our hand､ Samson our enemy.
content_old: 23 Now the lords of the Philistines had gathered themselves together to offer a great sacrifice unto Dagon their god､ and to rejoice,—and they said, Our god hath delivered into our hand､ Samson our enemy.

content: 24 And when the people saw him they praised their god,—for they said— Our god hath delivered into our hand our enemy, even him who laid waste our land, and who multiplied our slain.
content_old: 24 And when the people saw him they praised their god,—for they said— Our god hath delivered into our hand our enemy, even him who laid waste our land, and who multiplied our slain.

content: 25 And it came to pass when their heart was merry that they said, Call for Samson､ that he may make sport for us. So they called for Samson out of the prison､ and he made sport before them, and they stationed him between the pillars.
content_old: 25 And it came to pass when their heart was merry that they said, Call for Samson､ that he may make sport for us. So they called for Samson out of the prison､ and he made sport before them, and they stationed him between the pillars.

content: 26 And Samson said unto the youth that held him by his hand, Place me where I may feel the pillars whereon the house resteth, that I may lean upon them.
content_old: 26 And Samson said unto the youth that held him by his hand, Place me where I may feel the pillars whereon the house resteth, that I may lean upon them.
