content: 27 Now the house was full of men and women, there also were all the lords of the Philistines,—and on the roof were about three thousand men and women, looking on while Samson made sport.
content_old: 27 Now the house was full of men and women, there also were all the lords of the Philistines,—and on the roof were about three thousand men and women, looking on while Samson made sport.

content: 28 So then Samson cried unto Yahweh､ and said,— My Lord Yahweh! remember me､ I pray thee,—and strengthen me､ I pray thee､ only this once､ O God that I may be avenged with one avenging､ for my two eyes upon the Philistines.
content_old: 28 So then Samson cried unto Yahweh､ and said,— My Lord Yahweh! remember me､ I pray thee,—and strengthen me､ I pray thee､ only this once､ O God that I may be avenged with one avenging､ for my two eyes upon the Philistines.

content: 29 Then did Samson grasp the two middle pillars､ whereon the house rested, and whereon it was upheld, and he braced himself against them,—the one with his right hand､ and the other with his left.
content_old: 29 Then did Samson grasp the two middle pillars､ whereon the house rested, and whereon it was upheld, and he braced himself against them,—the one with his right hand､ and the other with his left.

content: 30 And Samson said— Let my soul die with the Philistines! And he bowed mightily, and the house fell upon the lords, and upon all the people that were therein. So the dead､ whom he slew at his death､ were more than they whom he slew in his life.
content_old: 30 And Samson said— Let my soul die with the Philistines! And he bowed mightily, and the house fell upon the lords, and upon all the people that were therein. So the dead､ whom he slew at his death､ were more than they whom he slew in his life.

content: 1 And there was a man of the hill country of Ephraim､ whose name was Micah.
content_old: 1 And there was a man of the hill country of Ephraim､ whose name was Micah.

content: 2 And he said unto his mother— The eleven hundred pieces of silver that were taken by thee､ when thou didst utter a curse､ and didst also say in my hearing, Lo! the silver is with me! I took it. Then said his mother, Blessed be my son by Yahweh.
content_old: 2 And he said unto his mother— The eleven hundred pieces of silver that were taken by thee､ when thou didst utter a curse､ and didst also say in my hearing, Lo! the silver is with me! I took it. Then said his mother, Blessed be my son by Yahweh.

content: 3 And when he had restored the eleven hundred shekels of silver to his mother his mother said— I had hallowed the silver unto Yahweh out of mine own hand､ for my son､ to make a graved (molten) image, now therefore､ I will restore it unto thee.
content_old: 3 And when he had restored the eleven hundred shekels of silver to his mother his mother said— I had hallowed the silver unto Yahweh out of mine own hand､ for my son､ to make a graved (molten) image, now therefore､ I will restore it unto thee.

content: 4 But he restored the silver to his mother,—so his mother took two hundred pieces of silver､ and gave it to the silversmith､ who made thereof a graved (molten) image, and it was in the house of Micah.
content_old: 4 But he restored the silver to his mother,—so his mother took two hundred pieces of silver､ and gave it to the silversmith､ who made thereof a graved (molten) image, and it was in the house of Micah.

content: 5 Now the man Micah had a house of gods,—and he made an ephod､ and teraphim, and installed one of his sons, who became his priest.
content_old: 5 Now the man Micah had a house of gods,—and he made an ephod､ and teraphim, and installed one of his sons, who became his priest.

content: 6 In those days there was no king in Israel,—every man did that which was right in his own eyes.
content_old: 6 In those days there was no king in Israel,—every man did that which was right in his own eyes.

content: 7 And there was a young man out of Bethlehem-judah, of the family of Judah,—he being a Levite､ and he being a sojourner there.
content_old: 7 And there was a young man out of Bethlehem-judah, of the family of Judah,—he being a Levite､ and he being a sojourner there.

content: 8 So the man took his journey out of the city､ out of Bethlehem-judah､ to sojourn､ wheresoever he could find a home,—and he came into the hill country of Ephraim､ as far as the house of Micah､ in pursuing his journey.
content_old: 8 So the man took his journey out of the city､ out of Bethlehem-judah､ to sojourn､ wheresoever he could find a home,—and he came into the hill country of Ephraim､ as far as the house of Micah､ in pursuing his journey.

content: 9 And Micah said unto him､ Whence comest thou? And he said unto him— A Levite am I, from Bethlehem-judah, and I am taking my journey to sojourn､ wheresoever I can find a home.
content_old: 9 And Micah said unto him､ Whence comest thou? And he said unto him— A Levite am I, from Bethlehem-judah, and I am taking my journey to sojourn､ wheresoever I can find a home.

content: 10 And Micah said unto him— Dwell with me､ and be to me a father and a priest, and I will give thee ten pieces of silver by the year, and a suit of apparel､ and thy sustenance. So the Levite went.
content_old: 10 And Micah said unto him— Dwell with me､ and be to me a father and a priest, and I will give thee ten pieces of silver by the year, and a suit of apparel､ and thy sustenance. So the Levite went.

content: 11 And the Levite was content to dwell with the man,—and the young man became to him､ as one of his sons.
content_old: 11 And the Levite was content to dwell with the man,—and the young man became to him､ as one of his sons.

content: 12 And Micah installed the Levite, and the young man became his priest,—and remained in the house of Micah.
content_old: 12 And Micah installed the Levite, and the young man became his priest,—and remained in the house of Micah.

content: 1 In those days there was no king in Israel,—and in those days the tribe of the Danites was seeking for itself an inheritance to dwell in for there had not fallen to them､ unto that day､ in the midst of the tribes of Israel､ enough for an inheritance.
content_old: 1 In those days there was no king in Israel,—and in those days the tribe of the Danites was seeking for itself an inheritance to dwell in for there had not fallen to them､ unto that day､ in the midst of the tribes of Israel､ enough for an inheritance.

content: 2 So then the sons of Dan sent､ out of their family､ five men out of their bounds—men who were sons of valour—out of Zorah and out of Eshtaol—to spy out the land､ and to explore it, and they said unto them, Go! explore the land. And they came into the hill country of Ephraim､ as far as the house of Micah, and lodged there.
content_old: 2 So then the sons of Dan sent､ out of their family､ five men out of their bounds—men who were sons of valour—out of Zorah and out of Eshtaol—to spy out the land､ and to explore it, and they said unto them, Go! explore the land. And they came into the hill country of Ephraim､ as far as the house of Micah, and lodged there.

content: 3 They being by the house of Micah knew the voice of the young man､ the Levite,—so they turned aside there､ and said to him— Who brought thee in hither? and what art thou doing in this place､ and what hast thou here?
content_old: 3 They being by the house of Micah knew the voice of the young man､ the Levite,—so they turned aside there､ and said to him— Who brought thee in hither? and what art thou doing in this place､ and what hast thou here?

content: 4 And he said unto them, Thus and so hath Micah dealt with me, and hath hired me､ and I am become his priest.
content_old: 4 And he said unto them, Thus and so hath Micah dealt with me, and hath hired me､ and I am become his priest.

content: 5 So they said unto him— Ask of God､ we pray thee,—that we may know whether the journey on which we are going shall have good success.
content_old: 5 So they said unto him— Ask of God､ we pray thee,—that we may know whether the journey on which we are going shall have good success.

content: 6 And the priest said unto them— Go! and prosper,—before Yahweh is your journey on which ye go.
content_old: 6 And the priest said unto them— Go! and prosper,—before Yahweh is your journey on which ye go.

content: 7 So the five men went their way, and entered Laish,—and saw the people who were therein､ dwelling securely, after the manner of the Zidonians quietly and securely, and there was no one to reproach them with anything in the land､ none to possess himself of dominion, they being far away from the Zidonians, and having no dealings with any one.
content_old: 7 So the five men went their way, and entered Laish,—and saw the people who were therein､ dwelling securely, after the manner of the Zidonians quietly and securely, and there was no one to reproach them with anything in the land､ none to possess himself of dominion, they being far away from the Zidonians, and having no dealings with any one.

content: 8 So they came unto their brethren, in Zorah and Eshtaol,—and their brethren said unto them— Why are ye minded to do nothing?
content_old: 8 So they came unto their brethren, in Zorah and Eshtaol,—and their brethren said unto them— Why are ye minded to do nothing?

content: 9 And they said— Arise! and let us go up against them, for we have seen the land, and lo! it is very good,—are ye､ then､ minded to do nothing? do not be too slothful to go､ and enter､ and take possession of the land.
content_old: 9 And they said— Arise! and let us go up against them, for we have seen the land, and lo! it is very good,—are ye､ then､ minded to do nothing? do not be too slothful to go､ and enter､ and take possession of the land.

content: 10 When ye do enter ye will enter amongst a people secure､ and the land is of ample bounds,—yea God hath delivered it into your hands,—a place where there is no lack of anything that is in the earth.
content_old: 10 When ye do enter ye will enter amongst a people secure､ and the land is of ample bounds,—yea God hath delivered it into your hands,—a place where there is no lack of anything that is in the earth.

content: 11 So there brake up from thence out of the family of the Danites, out of Zorah and out of Eshtaol six hundred men, begirt with weapons of war.
content_old: 11 So there brake up from thence out of the family of the Danites, out of Zorah and out of Eshtaol six hundred men, begirt with weapons of war.

content: 12 And they went up and encamped in Kiriath-jearim､ in Judah,—wherefore they have called that place､ Mahaneh-dan—unto this day, lo! it is behind Kiriath-jearim.
content_old: 12 And they went up and encamped in Kiriath-jearim､ in Judah,—wherefore they have called that place､ Mahaneh-dan—unto this day, lo! it is behind Kiriath-jearim.

content: 13 And they passed on from thence unto the hill country of Ephraim,—and came as far as the house of Micah.
content_old: 13 And they passed on from thence unto the hill country of Ephraim,—and came as far as the house of Micah.

content: 14 Then responded the five men who had been to spy out the land of Laish, and said unto their brethren, Know ye that there are in these houses､ an ephod, and teraphim, and a graven image､ and a molten image,—now therefore､ know what ye will do!
content_old: 14 Then responded the five men who had been to spy out the land of Laish, and said unto their brethren, Know ye that there are in these houses､ an ephod, and teraphim, and a graven image､ and a molten image,—now therefore､ know what ye will do!

content: 15 So they turned aside thither, and entered into the house of the young man the Levite､ the house of Micah,—and asked him of his welfare.
content_old: 15 So they turned aside thither, and entered into the house of the young man the Levite､ the house of Micah,—and asked him of his welfare.

content: 16 Now the six hundred men､ begirt with weapons of war were standing at the entrance of the gate,—they being of the sons of Dan.
content_old: 16 Now the six hundred men､ begirt with weapons of war were standing at the entrance of the gate,—they being of the sons of Dan.

content: 17 Then went up the five men who had been to spy out the land, they came in thither, they took the graven image､ and the ephod, and the teraphim､ and the molten image,—now the priest was standing at the entrance of the gate, with the six hundred men who were begirt with weapons of war.
content_old: 17 Then went up the five men who had been to spy out the land, they came in thither, they took the graven image､ and the ephod, and the teraphim､ and the molten image,—now the priest was standing at the entrance of the gate, with the six hundred men who were begirt with weapons of war.

content: 18 But when these had entered the house of Micah, and taken the graven image and the ephod, and the teraphim､ and the molten image the priest said unto them, What are ye doing?
content_old: 18 But when these had entered the house of Micah, and taken the graven image and the ephod, and the teraphim､ and the molten image the priest said unto them, What are ye doing?

content: 19 And they said unto him— Hold thy peace､ lay thy hand upon thy mouth､ and go with us, and become to us a father and a priest,—is it better that thou be priest to the house of one man, or that thou be priest to a tribe and to a family in Israel?
content_old: 19 And they said unto him— Hold thy peace､ lay thy hand upon thy mouth､ and go with us, and become to us a father and a priest,—is it better that thou be priest to the house of one man, or that thou be priest to a tribe and to a family in Israel?

content: 20 Then was the heart of the priest glad, and he took the ephod, and the teraphim､ and the graven image,—and came into the midst of the people.
content_old: 20 Then was the heart of the priest glad, and he took the ephod, and the teraphim､ and the graven image,—and came into the midst of the people.

content: 21 So they turned､ and went their way,—and put the little ones､ and the cattle､ and the goods､ before them.
content_old: 21 So they turned､ and went their way,—and put the little ones､ and the cattle､ and the goods､ before them.

content: 22 They had gone a good way from the house of Micah､ when the men that were in the houses near to the house of Micah were called out and overtook the sons of Dan.
content_old: 22 They had gone a good way from the house of Micah､ when the men that were in the houses near to the house of Micah were called out and overtook the sons of Dan.

content: 23 And they called unto the sons of Dan, who turned their faces,—and said unto Micah, What aileth thee､ that thou hast called out thy neighbours?
content_old: 23 And they called unto the sons of Dan, who turned their faces,—and said unto Micah, What aileth thee､ that thou hast called out thy neighbours?

content: 24 And he said— My gods which I had made ye have taken away､ and the priest､ and have departed､ and what have I more? How then is it that ye can say unto me､ What aileth thee?
content_old: 24 And he said— My gods which I had made ye have taken away､ and the priest､ and have departed､ and what have I more? How then is it that ye can say unto me､ What aileth thee?

content: 25 And the sons of Dan said unto him, Do not let thy voice be heard among us,—lest men embittered in soul fall upon you, and thou gather in thy life and the lives of thy household.
content_old: 25 And the sons of Dan said unto him, Do not let thy voice be heard among us,—lest men embittered in soul fall upon you, and thou gather in thy life and the lives of thy household.

content: 26 And the sons of Dan went on their journey,—and when Micah saw that they were too strong for him he turned and went back unto his house.
content_old: 26 And the sons of Dan went on their journey,—and when Micah saw that they were too strong for him he turned and went back unto his house.

content: 27 They､ therefore､ took what Micah had made､ and the priest that he had, and came upon Laish､ upon a people quiet and secure, and smote them with the edge of the sword,—the city also burned they with fire.
content_old: 27 They､ therefore､ took what Micah had made､ and the priest that he had, and came upon Laish､ upon a people quiet and secure, and smote them with the edge of the sword,—the city also burned they with fire.

content: 28 And there was no one to rescue､ because it was far from Zidon､ and they had no dealings with any one, it being in the vale that pertaineth to Beth-rehob. Then built they the city､ and dwelt therein,
content_old: 28 And there was no one to rescue､ because it was far from Zidon､ and they had no dealings with any one, it being in the vale that pertaineth to Beth-rehob. Then built they the city､ and dwelt therein,

content: 29 and called the name of the city Dan, by the name of Dan their father, who was born to Israel,—howbeit Laish was the name of the city at the first.
content_old: 29 and called the name of the city Dan, by the name of Dan their father, who was born to Israel,—howbeit Laish was the name of the city at the first.

content: 30 And the sons of Dan set up for themselves the graven image,—and Jonathan､ son of Gershom､ son of Moses､ he and his sons became priests to the tribe of the Danites, until the day of the captivity of the land.
content_old: 30 And the sons of Dan set up for themselves the graven image,—and Jonathan､ son of Gershom､ son of Moses､ he and his sons became priests to the tribe of the Danites, until the day of the captivity of the land.

content: 1 And it came to pass in those days, when king there was none in Israel that there was a certain Levite sojourning on the farther side of the hill country of Ephraim, who took to him a concubine out of Bethlehem-judah.
content_old: 1 And it came to pass in those days, when king there was none in Israel that there was a certain Levite sojourning on the farther side of the hill country of Ephraim, who took to him a concubine out of Bethlehem-judah.

content: 2 And his concubine went astray against him, and departed from him､ unto the house of her father, in Bethlehem-judah,—and remained there､ the space of four months.
content_old: 2 And his concubine went astray against him, and departed from him､ unto the house of her father, in Bethlehem-judah,—and remained there､ the space of four months.

content: 3 Then arose her husband､ and went after her､ to speak unto her heart､ that he might bring her back again, having his young man with him､ and a couple of asses,—and she brought him into the house of her father, and when the father of the damsel saw him he rejoiced to meet him.
content_old: 3 Then arose her husband､ and went after her､ to speak unto her heart､ that he might bring her back again, having his young man with him､ and a couple of asses,—and she brought him into the house of her father, and when the father of the damsel saw him he rejoiced to meet him.

content: 4 And his father-in-law､ the father of the damsel､ constrained him, and he abode with him three days,—and they did eat and drink､ and lodged there.
content_old: 4 And his father-in-law､ the father of the damsel､ constrained him, and he abode with him three days,—and they did eat and drink､ and lodged there.

content: 5 And it came to pass on the fourth day､ when they arose early in the morning､ and gat up to go that the father of the damsel said unto his son-in-law,— Stay thy heart with a morsel of bread､ and afterwards ye shall go your way.
content_old: 5 And it came to pass on the fourth day､ when they arose early in the morning､ and gat up to go that the father of the damsel said unto his son-in-law,— Stay thy heart with a morsel of bread､ and afterwards ye shall go your way.

content: 6 So they both of them sat down and did eat together､ and drink. Then said the father of the damsel unto the man, Be content､ I pray thee､and tarry the night､ and let thy heart be glad.
content_old: 6 So they both of them sat down and did eat together､ and drink. Then said the father of the damsel unto the man, Be content､ I pray thee､and tarry the night､ and let thy heart be glad.

content: 7 And when the man rose up to go his father-in-law pressed him, so be turned back and tarried the night there.
content_old: 7 And when the man rose up to go his father-in-law pressed him, so be turned back and tarried the night there.

content: 8 And when he arose early on the morning of the fifth day､ to go the father of the damsel said— Come now､ stay thy heart, and tarry ye until the decline of the day. And they did eat, both of them.
content_old: 8 And when he arose early on the morning of the fifth day､ to go the father of the damsel said— Come now､ stay thy heart, and tarry ye until the decline of the day. And they did eat, both of them.

content: 9 And when the man rose up to go—he and his concubine and his young man—his father-in-law, the father of the damsel, said to him, Come now､ see! the day hath sunk down towards evening､ come now! tarry the night; lo! the day goeth down､ tarry the night here､ and let thy heart be glad, so shall ye rise early to-morrow for your journey, and thou shalt go thy way to thine own home.
content_old: 9 And when the man rose up to go—he and his concubine and his young man—his father-in-law, the father of the damsel, said to him, Come now､ see! the day hath sunk down towards evening､ come now! tarry the night; lo! the day goeth down､ tarry the night here､ and let thy heart be glad, so shall ye rise early to-morrow for your journey, and thou shalt go thy way to thine own home.

content: 10 But the man would not tarry the night, but rose up and went his way, and came as far as over against Jebus, the same is Jerusalem,—and with him were a couple of asses､ saddled, his concubine also was with him.
content_old: 10 But the man would not tarry the night, but rose up and went his way, and came as far as over against Jebus, the same is Jerusalem,—and with him were a couple of asses､ saddled, his concubine also was with him.

content: 11 They being by Jebus, and the day having gone far down the young man said unto his lord— Do come､ I pray thee､ and let us turn aside into this city of the Jebusites, and tarry the night therein.
content_old: 11 They being by Jebus, and the day having gone far down the young man said unto his lord— Do come､ I pray thee､ and let us turn aside into this city of the Jebusites, and tarry the night therein.

content: 12 And his lord said unto him, We will not turn aside into a city of aliens, who are not of the sons of Israel,—but will pass on as far as Gibeah.
content_old: 12 And his lord said unto him, We will not turn aside into a city of aliens, who are not of the sons of Israel,—but will pass on as far as Gibeah.

content: 13 And he said to his young man, Come and let us draw near unto one of the places,—and tarry the night in Gibeah､ or in Ramah.
content_old: 13 And he said to his young man, Come and let us draw near unto one of the places,—and tarry the night in Gibeah､ or in Ramah.

content: 14 So they passed on､ and went their way,—and the sun went in upon them beside Gibeah､ which belongeth to Benjamin.
content_old: 14 So they passed on､ and went their way,—and the sun went in upon them beside Gibeah､ which belongeth to Benjamin.

content: 15 Then turned they aside there, to go in and tarry the night in Gibeah,—so he went in and abode in the broad-way of the city; and there was no one minded to take them into a house､ to tarry the night.
content_old: 15 Then turned they aside there, to go in and tarry the night in Gibeah,—so he went in and abode in the broad-way of the city; and there was no one minded to take them into a house､ to tarry the night.

content: 16 But lo! an old man coming in from his work､ out of the field､ in the evening, and the man was from the hill country of Ephraim, he himself being a sojourner in Gibeah,—but the men of the place were Benjamites.
content_old: 16 But lo! an old man coming in from his work､ out of the field､ in the evening, and the man was from the hill country of Ephraim, he himself being a sojourner in Gibeah,—but the men of the place were Benjamites.

content: 17 So he lifted up his eyes､ and saw a wayfaring man in the broadway of the city,—and the old man said— Whither goest thou? and from whence hast thou come?
content_old: 17 So he lifted up his eyes､ and saw a wayfaring man in the broadway of the city,—and the old man said— Whither goest thou? and from whence hast thou come?

content: 18 And he said unto him— We are passing along from Bethlehem-judah､ unto the farther side of the hill country of Ephraim, whence I am, but I have been as far as Bethlehem-judah, and now unto the house of Yahweh am I going, and there is no one minded to take me into a house.
content_old: 18 And he said unto him— We are passing along from Bethlehem-judah､ unto the farther side of the hill country of Ephraim, whence I am, but I have been as far as Bethlehem-judah, and now unto the house of Yahweh am I going, and there is no one minded to take me into a house.

content: 19 Nevertheless straw and fodder too is there for our asses, yea moreover bread and wine there are for me､ and for thy handmaid, and for the young man that is with thy servants,—there is lack of nothing.
content_old: 19 Nevertheless straw and fodder too is there for our asses, yea moreover bread and wine there are for me､ and for thy handmaid, and for the young man that is with thy servants,—there is lack of nothing.

content: 20 And the old man said— Thou art welcome! only all thy wants be on me,—by no means in the broadway mayest thou lodge.
content_old: 20 And the old man said— Thou art welcome! only all thy wants be on me,—by no means in the broadway mayest thou lodge.

content: 21 So he brought him into his house, and gave provender to the asses,—and they bathed their feet, and did eat and drink.
content_old: 21 So he brought him into his house, and gave provender to the asses,—and they bathed their feet, and did eat and drink.

content: 22 They were gladdening their heart, when lo! men of the city､ men of the sons of the Abandoned One beset the house round about, beating violently against the door,—and they spake unto the old man the owner of the house､ saying, Bring forth the man that hath entered into thy house､ that we may know him.
content_old: 22 They were gladdening their heart, when lo! men of the city､ men of the sons of the Abandoned One beset the house round about, beating violently against the door,—and they spake unto the old man the owner of the house､ saying, Bring forth the man that hath entered into thy house､ that we may know him.

content: 23 And the man､ the owner of the house､ went forth unto them, and said unto them, Do not､ my brethren､ do not act vilely､ I pray you,—after this man hath entered into my house do not commit this impiety.
content_old: 23 And the man､ the owner of the house､ went forth unto them, and said unto them, Do not､ my brethren､ do not act vilely､ I pray you,—after this man hath entered into my house do not commit this impiety.

content: 24 Lo my virgin daughter､ and his concubine I must needs now bring them forth､ and ye must humble them, and do unto them what seemeth good in your own eyes,—but unto this man must ye not do this impious thing!
content_old: 24 Lo my virgin daughter､ and his concubine I must needs now bring them forth､ and ye must humble them, and do unto them what seemeth good in your own eyes,—but unto this man must ye not do this impious thing!

content: 25 But the men would not hearken unto him, so the man laid hold on his concubine, and brought her forth unto them､ outside,—and they knew her､ and abused her all the night､ until the morning, and let her go at the uprisings of the dawn.
content_old: 25 But the men would not hearken unto him, so the man laid hold on his concubine, and brought her forth unto them､ outside,—and they knew her､ and abused her all the night､ until the morning, and let her go at the uprisings of the dawn.

content: 26 So the woman came in at the turnings of the morning,—and fell down at the entrance of the man’s house where her lord was､ and lay there till it was light.
content_old: 26 So the woman came in at the turnings of the morning,—and fell down at the entrance of the man’s house where her lord was､ and lay there till it was light.

content: 27 So then her lord rose up in the morning､ and opened the doors of the house, and went forth､ to go on his journey,—when lo! the woman､ his concubine fallen at the entrance of the house, with her hands upon the threshold.
content_old: 27 So then her lord rose up in the morning､ and opened the doors of the house, and went forth､ to go on his journey,—when lo! the woman､ his concubine fallen at the entrance of the house, with her hands upon the threshold.

content: 28 And he said unto her— Up! and let us be going. But there was no answer. So he took her up on the ass, and the man rose up, and went his way to his own place.
content_old: 28 And he said unto her— Up! and let us be going. But there was no answer. So he took her up on the ass, and the man rose up, and went his way to his own place.

content: 29 And when he was come into his house he took a knife､ and laid hold on his concubine, and divided her､ limb by limb, into twelve pieces,—and sent her throughout all the bounds of Israel.
content_old: 29 And when he was come into his house he took a knife､ and laid hold on his concubine, and divided her､ limb by limb, into twelve pieces,—and sent her throughout all the bounds of Israel.

content: 1 Then went forth all the sons of Israel, and the assembly came together as one man､ from Dan even to Beer-sheba with the land of Gilead,—unto Yahweh at Mizpah.
content_old: 1 Then went forth all the sons of Israel, and the assembly came together as one man､ from Dan even to Beer-sheba with the land of Gilead,—unto Yahweh at Mizpah.

content: 2 And the chiefs of all the people—all the tribes of Israel—presented themselves in the convocation of the people of God,—four hundred thousand footmen､ that drew the sword.
content_old: 2 And the chiefs of all the people—all the tribes of Israel—presented themselves in the convocation of the people of God,—four hundred thousand footmen､ that drew the sword.

content: 3 And the sons of Benjamin heard that the sons of Israel had gone up to Mizpah. Then said the sons of Israel, Tell us, In what manner was brought to pass this vileness?
content_old: 3 And the sons of Benjamin heard that the sons of Israel had gone up to Mizpah. Then said the sons of Israel, Tell us, In what manner was brought to pass this vileness?

content: 4 And the Levite､ husband of the woman that was cut in pieces､ responded and said,— Into Gibeah that pertaineth to Benjamin I entered I and my concubine to tarry the night.
content_old: 4 And the Levite､ husband of the woman that was cut in pieces､ responded and said,— Into Gibeah that pertaineth to Benjamin I entered I and my concubine to tarry the night.

content: 5 And the owners of Gibeah rose up against me, and beset the house､ for my sake､ by night,—me they thought to slay, and my concubine they so humbled､ that she died.
content_old: 5 And the owners of Gibeah rose up against me, and beset the house､ for my sake､ by night,—me they thought to slay, and my concubine they so humbled､ that she died.

content: 6 So I laid hold on my concubine､ and cut her in pieces, and sent her throughout all the country of the inheritance of Israel,—because they had wrought lewdness and impiety､ in Israel.
content_old: 6 So I laid hold on my concubine､ and cut her in pieces, and sent her throughout all the country of the inheritance of Israel,—because they had wrought lewdness and impiety､ in Israel.

content: 7 Lo! ye all are sons of Israel,—give your word and counsel､ here.
content_old: 7 Lo! ye all are sons of Israel,—give your word and counsel､ here.

content: 8 Then arose all the people, as one man､ saying,— No man of us will go to his tent, and no man of us will turn aside to his house.
content_old: 8 Then arose all the people, as one man､ saying,— No man of us will go to his tent, and no man of us will turn aside to his house.

content: 9 Now therefore､ this is the thing that we will do to Gibeah,—Go against it by lot;
content_old: 9 Now therefore､ this is the thing that we will do to Gibeah,—Go against it by lot;

content: 10 and we will take ten men of a hundred､ of all the tribes of Israel､ and a hundred of a thousand, and a thousand of ten thousand, to fetch provisions for the people,—that they may do､ when they come to Gibeah of Benjamin､ according to all the impiety that it hath wrought in Israel.
content_old: 10 and we will take ten men of a hundred､ of all the tribes of Israel､ and a hundred of a thousand, and a thousand of ten thousand, to fetch provisions for the people,—that they may do､ when they come to Gibeah of Benjamin､ according to all the impiety that it hath wrought in Israel.

content: 11 So all the men of Israel were gathered together against the city, as one man knit together.
content_old: 11 So all the men of Israel were gathered together against the city, as one man knit together.

content: 12 And the tribes of Israel sent men throughout all the divisions of Benjamin､ saying,— What is this vile thing that hath been brought to pass､ among you?
content_old: 12 And the tribes of Israel sent men throughout all the divisions of Benjamin､ saying,— What is this vile thing that hath been brought to pass､ among you?

content: 13 Now therefore､ deliver up the men—the sons of the Abandoned One—who are in Gibeah､ that we may put them to death, and vileness be consumed out of Israel. But the sons of Benjamin would not hearken unto the voice of their brethren､ the sons of Israel.
content_old: 13 Now therefore､ deliver up the men—the sons of the Abandoned One—who are in Gibeah､ that we may put them to death, and vileness be consumed out of Israel. But the sons of Benjamin would not hearken unto the voice of their brethren､ the sons of Israel.

content: 14 Then did the sons of Benjamin gather themselves together out of the cities､ unto Gibeah,—to go forth to battle against the sons of Israel.
content_old: 14 Then did the sons of Benjamin gather themselves together out of the cities､ unto Gibeah,—to go forth to battle against the sons of Israel.

content: 15 And the sons of Benjamin were numbered on that day､ out of the cities, twenty-six thousand men､ that drew the sword,—besides of the inhabitants of Gibeah were numbered seven hundred chosen men.
content_old: 15 And the sons of Benjamin were numbered on that day､ out of the cities, twenty-six thousand men､ that drew the sword,—besides of the inhabitants of Gibeah were numbered seven hundred chosen men.

content: 16 Out of all this people were seven hundred chosen men､ left-handed,—any one of whom could sling with a stone to a hair’s-breadth､ and not miss.
content_old: 16 Out of all this people were seven hundred chosen men､ left-handed,—any one of whom could sling with a stone to a hair’s-breadth､ and not miss.

content: 17 And the men of Israel were numbered､ apart from Benjamin､ four hundred thousand men､ that drew the sword,—every one of these being a man of war.
content_old: 17 And the men of Israel were numbered､ apart from Benjamin､ four hundred thousand men､ that drew the sword,—every one of these being a man of war.

content: 18 And they arose､ and went up to Bethel､ and asked of God, and the sons of Israel said, Who shall go up for us first, to fight against the sons of Benjamin? And Yahweh said— Judah first.
content_old: 18 And they arose､ and went up to Bethel､ and asked of God, and the sons of Israel said, Who shall go up for us first, to fight against the sons of Benjamin? And Yahweh said— Judah first.

content: 19 And the sons of Israel arose in the morning,—and encamped against Gibeah.
content_old: 19 And the sons of Israel arose in the morning,—and encamped against Gibeah.

content: 20 And the men of Israel went forth, to fight against Benjamin,—so the men of Israel set themselves in array against them､ to fight against Gibeah.
content_old: 20 And the men of Israel went forth, to fight against Benjamin,—so the men of Israel set themselves in array against them､ to fight against Gibeah.

content: 21 Then came forth the sons of Benjamin out of Gibeah,—and laid low of Israel､ on that day､ twenty-two thousand men､ to the ground.
content_old: 21 Then came forth the sons of Benjamin out of Gibeah,—and laid low of Israel､ on that day､ twenty-two thousand men､ to the ground.

content: 22 And the people､ the men of Israel､ encouraged themselves,—and again set themselves in array for battle in the place where they had set themselves in array on the first day.
content_old: 22 And the people､ the men of Israel､ encouraged themselves,—and again set themselves in array for battle in the place where they had set themselves in array on the first day.

content: 23 Now the sons of Israel had gone up､ and wept before Yahweh､ until the evening, and asked of Yahweh､ saying, Shall I again draw near to battle against the sons of Benjamin､ my brother? And Yahweh said､ Go up against him.
content_old: 23 Now the sons of Israel had gone up､ and wept before Yahweh､ until the evening, and asked of Yahweh､ saying, Shall I again draw near to battle against the sons of Benjamin､ my brother? And Yahweh said､ Go up against him.

content: 24 So the sons of Israel came near against the sons of Benjamin､ on the second day.
content_old: 24 So the sons of Israel came near against the sons of Benjamin､ on the second day.

content: 25 And Benjamin came forth to meet them out of Gibeah､ on the second day, and laid low､ of the sons of Israel､ yet eighteen thousand men､ to the ground,—all these drew the sword.
content_old: 25 And Benjamin came forth to meet them out of Gibeah､ on the second day, and laid low､ of the sons of Israel､ yet eighteen thousand men､ to the ground,—all these drew the sword.

content: 26 Then went up all the sons of Israel､ and all the people､ and came to Bethel､ and wept､ and tarried there before Yahweh, and fasted on that day､ until the evening,—and caused to go up ascending-sacrifices and peace-offerings､ before Yahweh.
content_old: 26 Then went up all the sons of Israel､ and all the people､ and came to Bethel､ and wept､ and tarried there before Yahweh, and fasted on that day､ until the evening,—and caused to go up ascending-sacrifices and peace-offerings､ before Yahweh.

content: 27 And the sons of Israel asked of Yahweh,—there being the ark of the covenant of God, in those days;
content_old: 27 And the sons of Israel asked of Yahweh,—there being the ark of the covenant of God, in those days;

content: 28 and Phinehas､ son of Eleazar､ son of Aaron was standing before it in those days､ saying: Shall I yet again go forth to battle､ against the sons of Benjamin､ my brother､ or shall I forbear? And Yahweh said— Go up, for to-morrow will I deliver him into thy hand.
content_old: 28 and Phinehas､ son of Eleazar､ son of Aaron was standing before it in those days､ saying: Shall I yet again go forth to battle､ against the sons of Benjamin､ my brother､ or shall I forbear? And Yahweh said— Go up, for to-morrow will I deliver him into thy hand.

content: 29 And Israel set liers in wait against Gibeah､ round about.
content_old: 29 And Israel set liers in wait against Gibeah､ round about.

content: 30 So the sons of Israel went up against the sons of Benjamin､ on the third day,—and set themselves in array against Gibeah､ as time after time.
content_old: 30 So the sons of Israel went up against the sons of Benjamin､ on the third day,—and set themselves in array against Gibeah､ as time after time.

content: 31 And the sons of Benjamin came forth against the people, they were drawn away from the city,—and began to smite of the people､ slaying as time after time､ in the highways､ whereof one goeth up to Bethel､ and the other to Gibeah in the field, about thirty men in Israel.
content_old: 31 And the sons of Benjamin came forth against the people, they were drawn away from the city,—and began to smite of the people､ slaying as time after time､ in the highways､ whereof one goeth up to Bethel､ and the other to Gibeah in the field, about thirty men in Israel.

content: 32 Then said the sons of Benjamin, They are being smitten before us､ as at the first. But the sons of Israel had said— Let us flee､ and draw them away from the city､ into the highways.
content_old: 32 Then said the sons of Benjamin, They are being smitten before us､ as at the first. But the sons of Israel had said— Let us flee､ and draw them away from the city､ into the highways.

content: 33 And all the men of Israel rose up out of their place, and set themselves in array in Baaltamar,—and the liers in wait of Israel began to break forth out of their place､ out of the forest of Gibeah.
content_old: 33 And all the men of Israel rose up out of their place, and set themselves in array in Baaltamar,—and the liers in wait of Israel began to break forth out of their place､ out of the forest of Gibeah.

content: 34 And there came over against Gibeah ten thousand chosen men､ out of all Israel, and the battle was severe,—they not knowing that disaster was overtaking them.
content_old: 34 And there came over against Gibeah ten thousand chosen men､ out of all Israel, and the battle was severe,—they not knowing that disaster was overtaking them.

content: 35 Thus Yahweh smote Benjamin before Israel, and the sons of Israel destroyed in Benjamin､ that day､ twenty-five thousand and one hundred men,—all these drew the sword.
content_old: 35 Thus Yahweh smote Benjamin before Israel, and the sons of Israel destroyed in Benjamin､ that day､ twenty-five thousand and one hundred men,—all these drew the sword.

content: 36 So the sons of Benjamin saw that they were smitten,—and that the men of Israel had given place to Benjamin, because they trusted to the liers in wait, whom they had set near Gibeah.
content_old: 36 So the sons of Benjamin saw that they were smitten,—and that the men of Israel had given place to Benjamin, because they trusted to the liers in wait, whom they had set near Gibeah.

content: 37 And the liers in wait hasted, and rushed upon Gibeah,—and the liers in wait marched forward, and smote all the city with the edge of the sword.
content_old: 37 And the liers in wait hasted, and rushed upon Gibeah,—and the liers in wait marched forward, and smote all the city with the edge of the sword.

content: 38 Now the appointed sign between the men of Israel and the liers in wait､ had been,—to cause a great cloud of smoke to ascend out of the city.
content_old: 38 Now the appointed sign between the men of Israel and the liers in wait､ had been,—to cause a great cloud of smoke to ascend out of the city.

content: 39 So when the men of Israel turned in the battle,—and the Benjamites began to smite and slay of the sons of Israel､ about thirty men, for they said, Yea! they are smitten before us, as in the first battle
content_old: 39 So when the men of Israel turned in the battle,—and the Benjamites began to smite and slay of the sons of Israel､ about thirty men, for they said, Yea! they are smitten before us, as in the first battle

content: 40 then the cloud began to ascend out of the the city､ a pillar of smoke,—and the Benjamites looked behind them, and lo! the whole city flamed up towards the heavens.
content_old: 40 then the cloud began to ascend out of the the city､ a pillar of smoke,—and the Benjamites looked behind them, and lo! the whole city flamed up towards the heavens.

content: 41 And when the men of Israel turned then were the men of Benjamin dismayed,—for they saw that disaster had overtaken them.
content_old: 41 And when the men of Israel turned then were the men of Benjamin dismayed,—for they saw that disaster had overtaken them.

content: 42 And when they turned before the men of Israel unto the way of the desert the battle overtook them,—while as for them that came out of the cities they began to destroy them in their midst:—
content_old: 42 And when they turned before the men of Israel unto the way of the desert the battle overtook them,—while as for them that came out of the cities they began to destroy them in their midst:—

content: 43 they hemmed in the Benjamites､ they pursued them, with ease trode they them down,—as far as over against Gilbeah､ towards sunrise.
content_old: 43 they hemmed in the Benjamites､ they pursued them, with ease trode they them down,—as far as over against Gilbeah､ towards sunrise.

content: 44 So there fell of Benjamin､ eighteen thousand men,—all these being men of valour.
content_old: 44 So there fell of Benjamin､ eighteen thousand men,—all these being men of valour.

content: 45 And when they turned and fled towards the desert unto the cliff Rimmon then gleaned they of them､ in the highways, five thousand men,—and they followed hard after them as far as Gidôm, and smote of them､ two thousand men.
content_old: 45 And when they turned and fled towards the desert unto the cliff Rimmon then gleaned they of them､ in the highways, five thousand men,—and they followed hard after them as far as Gidôm, and smote of them､ two thousand men.

content: 46 So then it came to pass that all the fallen of Benjamin were twenty-five thousand men､ that drew the sword､ on that day,—all these being men of valour.
content_old: 46 So then it came to pass that all the fallen of Benjamin were twenty-five thousand men､ that drew the sword､ on that day,—all these being men of valour.

content: 47 But there turned and fled､ towards the desert､ unto the cliff Rimmon､ six hundred men,—who abode in the cliff Rimmon､ four months.
content_old: 47 But there turned and fled､ towards the desert､ unto the cliff Rimmon､ six hundred men,—who abode in the cliff Rimmon､ four months.

content: 1 Now the men of Israel had sworn in Mizpah､ saying,— Not a man from among us shall give his daughter unto Benjamin､ to wife.
content_old: 1 Now the men of Israel had sworn in Mizpah､ saying,— Not a man from among us shall give his daughter unto Benjamin､ to wife.

content: 2 So then the people came to Bethel, and abode there､ until the evening, before God,—and lifted up their voice, and wept bitterly,
content_old: 2 So then the people came to Bethel, and abode there､ until the evening, before God,—and lifted up their voice, and wept bitterly,

content: 3 and said, Wherefore, O Yahweh､ God of Israel, hath this come about in Israel,—that there should be lacking､ to-day､ out of Israel､ one tribe?
content_old: 3 and said, Wherefore, O Yahweh､ God of Israel, hath this come about in Israel,—that there should be lacking､ to-day､ out of Israel､ one tribe?

content: 4 And it came to pass､ on the morrow, that the people rose early, and built there､ an altar,—and offered ascending-sacrifices､ and peace-offerings.
content_old: 4 And it came to pass､ on the morrow, that the people rose early, and built there､ an altar,—and offered ascending-sacrifices､ and peace-offerings.

content: 5 And the sons of Israel said, Who was there that came not up､ in the convocation､ out of all the tribes of Israel､ unto Yahweh? For the great oath had been taken､ as to any who came not up unto Yahweh at Mizpah､ saying— He shall be put to death.
content_old: 5 And the sons of Israel said, Who was there that came not up､ in the convocation､ out of all the tribes of Israel､ unto Yahweh? For the great oath had been taken､ as to any who came not up unto Yahweh at Mizpah､ saying— He shall be put to death.

content: 6 And the sons of Israel grieved for Benjamin､ their brother,—and they said, There is cut off､ to-day､ one tribe out of Israel.
content_old: 6 And the sons of Israel grieved for Benjamin､ their brother,—and they said, There is cut off､ to-day､ one tribe out of Israel.

content: 7 What are we to do for them who remain､ for wives,—seeing that we ourselves have sworn by Yahweh, not to give them of our daughters､ for wives?
content_old: 7 What are we to do for them who remain､ for wives,—seeing that we ourselves have sworn by Yahweh, not to give them of our daughters､ for wives?

content: 8 So they said, What one of the tribes of Israel is there､ that hath not come up unto Yahweh at Mizpah? And lo! no man had come into the camp､ out of Jabesh-gilead､ unto the convocation:
content_old: 8 So they said, What one of the tribes of Israel is there､ that hath not come up unto Yahweh at Mizpah? And lo! no man had come into the camp､ out of Jabesh-gilead､ unto the convocation:

content: 9 When the people were numbered lo! there was not there a man of the inhabitants of Jabesh-gilead.
content_old: 9 When the people were numbered lo! there was not there a man of the inhabitants of Jabesh-gilead.

content: 10 So the assembly sent thither twelve thousand men､ of the sons of valour,—and commanded them､ saying:— Go and smite the inhabitants of Jabesh-gilead､ with the edge of the sword, with the women､ and the little ones.
content_old: 10 So the assembly sent thither twelve thousand men､ of the sons of valour,—and commanded them､ saying:— Go and smite the inhabitants of Jabesh-gilead､ with the edge of the sword, with the women､ and the little ones.

content: 11 And this is the thing that ye shall do,—Every male, and every woman that hath cohabited with man shall ye devote to destruction.
content_old: 11 And this is the thing that ye shall do,—Every male, and every woman that hath cohabited with man shall ye devote to destruction.

content: 12 And they found—of the inhabitants of Jabesh-gilead—four hundred young women､ virgins, who had not cohabited with man,—so they brought them into the camp､ at Shiloh, which is in the land of Canaan.
content_old: 12 And they found—of the inhabitants of Jabesh-gilead—four hundred young women､ virgins, who had not cohabited with man,—so they brought them into the camp､ at Shiloh, which is in the land of Canaan.

content: 13 Then the whole assembly sent, and spake unto the sons of Benjamin, who were in the cliff Rimmon,—and proclaimed to them､ peace.
content_old: 13 Then the whole assembly sent, and spake unto the sons of Benjamin, who were in the cliff Rimmon,—and proclaimed to them､ peace.

content: 14 So Benjamin returned at that time, and they gave them the women whom they had saved alive of the women of Jabesh-gilead,—but they found not for them to suffice even so.
content_old: 14 So Benjamin returned at that time, and they gave them the women whom they had saved alive of the women of Jabesh-gilead,—but they found not for them to suffice even so.

content: 15 Now the assembly had grieved for Benjamin,—because Yahweh had made a breach､ in the tribes of Israel.
content_old: 15 Now the assembly had grieved for Benjamin,—because Yahweh had made a breach､ in the tribes of Israel.

content: 16 So then､ the elders of the assembly said, What are we to do for them who remain､ for wives,—for womankind hath been destroyed out of Benjamin?
content_old: 16 So then､ the elders of the assembly said, What are we to do for them who remain､ for wives,—for womankind hath been destroyed out of Benjamin?

content: 17 And they said, There is an inheritance for the escaped of Benjamin,—and there must not be wiped out､ a tribe､ out of Israel.
content_old: 17 And they said, There is an inheritance for the escaped of Benjamin,—and there must not be wiped out､ a tribe､ out of Israel.

content: 18 Yet we may not give them wives､ of our own daughters, For the sons of Israel had sworn､ saying, Cursed be he that giveth a wife to Benjamin.
content_old: 18 Yet we may not give them wives､ of our own daughters, For the sons of Israel had sworn､ saying, Cursed be he that giveth a wife to Benjamin.

content: 19 Then said they— Lo! the festival of Yahweh in Shiloh､ from year to year, Which Shiloh is on the north of Bethel､ towards sunrise, by the highway that goeth up from Bethel､ towards Shechem, and on the south of Lebonah.
content_old: 19 Then said they— Lo! the festival of Yahweh in Shiloh､ from year to year, Which Shiloh is on the north of Bethel､ towards sunrise, by the highway that goeth up from Bethel､ towards Shechem, and on the south of Lebonah.

content: 20 And they commanded the sons of Benjamin, saying,— Go and lie in wait in the vineyards;
content_old: 20 And they commanded the sons of Benjamin, saying,— Go and lie in wait in the vineyards;

content: 21 and look､ and lo! if the daughters of Shiloh come out to dance in the dances then shall ye come forth out of the vineyards, and catch you every man his wife､ of the daughters of Shiloh,—and go your way to the land of Benjamin.
content_old: 21 and look､ and lo! if the daughters of Shiloh come out to dance in the dances then shall ye come forth out of the vineyards, and catch you every man his wife､ of the daughters of Shiloh,—and go your way to the land of Benjamin.

content: 22 And it shall be when their fathers､ or their brethren､ come in to complain to us that I we will say unto them— As a favour to us､ grant them, because we took not for each man his wife in the battle,—for ye yourselves gave them not unto them､ so as now to be guilty.
content_old: 22 And it shall be when their fathers､ or their brethren､ come in to complain to us that I we will say unto them— As a favour to us､ grant them, because we took not for each man his wife in the battle,—for ye yourselves gave them not unto them､ so as now to be guilty.

content: 23 And the sons of Benjamin did so, and carried off wives､ according to their number, of them who were dancing､ whom they seized,—and they went their way､ and returned unto their inheritance, and built the cities, and dwelt therein.
content_old: 23 And the sons of Benjamin did so, and carried off wives､ according to their number, of them who were dancing､ whom they seized,—and they went their way､ and returned unto their inheritance, and built the cities, and dwelt therein.

content: 24 And the sons of Israel at that time went their several ways from thence､ every man to his own tribe､ and to his own family,—yea they went forth from thence, every man to his own inheritance.
content_old: 24 And the sons of Israel at that time went their several ways from thence､ every man to his own tribe､ and to his own family,—yea they went forth from thence, every man to his own inheritance.
